loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 36 years old. She is married to Danilo, who helps her in her business. She make nipa huts for sale. She usually earns PHP 300 a day. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more nipa to weave. She needs to purchase more nipa to increase her sales, which will enable her to improve their poor living condition.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to weave

loans.name: Faanimo

texts.en: Faanimo is 52 years old and married with 8 children. She runs a small business selling ice-cake in her community, and she has been doing this for 3 years. Faanimo has requested a loan to buy ingredients needed for making her ice-cakes. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faanimo will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, foam cups, flavorings, and a new freezer.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 51 years old, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband works for a printing factory. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family through the income that she earns from selling pork noodles to the people in her local community. She began this business seven years ago. 

Phuong intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of ingredients and food to sell, and she also would like to use a part of the loan for her children's tuition fees. The additional capital will enable her to increase her sales of food and better meet her customers' demands. She hopes that her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food to sell from her stall and to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a shoe maker. Phuoc runs a tailor shop to earn a living. 

She started her business six years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different fabrics and sewing materials to attract more new customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel, 32, has been selling dried fish and shrimp in the village for almost three years.  Liezel started this business as a way of earning extra income, but she lacks the financial support to make her income grow. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase dried fish and shrimp. The loan will be of great help in achieving higher sales, enabling her to offer her family a better standard of living and to support her child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and shrimp

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 52, is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is an accountant.

Van has been running a general store in front of her house for twenty years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy different products such as shampoo, detergent and food to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Tuaoimalii

texts.en: Tuaoimaalii is a 22-year-old married woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows different vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tuaoimaalii has requested a loan to buy equipment and other things needed for running her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Tuaoimaalii hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, a wheel barrow, gloves, and bush knives.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda manages a retail store, livestock, and a farming business. She is 37 years old, and has two children.  Minda aspires to have a growing business so she can obtain greater income for her family needs, and for the education of her children.

Minda would like to increase the stock of grocery items she offers in her locality.  Due to insufficient capital, she is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000  to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, and assorted biscuits for her retail store. She believes that this loan will help her realize her dreams in life, and in her business.

Minda hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, and assorted biscuits for her retail store.

loans.name: Vira

texts.en: Vira is 56 years old and widowed with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, sugar, freezers, salt, flour, etc. She has been doing this for many years. Vira needs a loan to re-stock her small shop. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sugar, salt, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for coconut meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang, 41, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a bricklayer. She supports her family by running a general store in front of her house and by making masks to sell. 

She started these activities two years ago. From her store she sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community, and she also makes and supplies masks to other retailers. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying fabric to increase her production of masks and a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making masks and food and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Talaave

texts.en: Talaave is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Talaave has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to funds. With her earnings, Talaave will improve her business.

loans.use: To sugar, flour, cooking oil, and a large cooking pot

loans.name: Ivania Veronica

texts.es:
Ivania, 32 años de edad, es una sencilla ama de casa , habitante de la ciudad de León , madre de 2 hijos de 11 y 13 años de edad. Ella se dedica a vender Vigoron una comida típica hecha a base de yuca, chicharrón y ensalada de repollo  servida en hojas de plátano popularmente conocida como hojas de ´´chagüite´´. Tiene 10 años de dedicándose a este negocio con cual apoya a su familia. La mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes estudiantes de las universidades a quienes le resulta pagar este tipo de comida por su  bajo costo además de ser muy sabrosa. Ella desea poner en lo futuro una pulpería bien surtida de productos varios.
Por el momento ella usara el crédito para comprar  yuca, repollo, tomates, cebolla, carne, platos desechables.  El financiamiento le permitirá comprar materia prima al por mayor y vender mayor cantidad para mejorar los ingresos y atraer mayor cantidad de clientes que desean probar su sabroso¨ Vigoron con mucho sabor¨.
texts.en:
Ivania, 32, is a modest housewife. She resides in the city of León. She is the mother of two children, aged 11 and 13. She sells vigorón, a traditional food made with yuca, chicharrón, and cabbage salad wrapped in plantain leaves popularly known as chagüite leaves. She has been working in this business, with which she supports her family, for 10 years. The majority of her customers are young university students who buy this type of food because of its low cost, and because it's very delicious.She wants to open up a small grocery store in the future that's well stocked with various products. 

For the time being, she will use this loan to buy yuca, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, meat, and disposable plates. The loan will allow her to buy wholesale ingredients, to sell a greater quantity to improve her income, and to attract a greater number of customers who want to try her delicious and flavorful vigorón.

loans.use: to buy yuca, cabbage, tomatoes, onion, meat, and disposable plates.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 47 years old, and is married with two sons. She and her husband have been running a food stall and sewing masks for twenty years. They started this business to cover their expenses, and raise their children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and buying fabric to increase her production of masks, so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to offer more food and buy more fabric to increase her production of masks.

loans.name: Lua

texts.en:
Lua is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her two daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker in a local company. For five years, she has been running a general store to sell personal items and household products for people in her community.

Lua would like a loan to purchase better quality products at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase better quality products (like food and beverages) at competitive prices from wholesalers

loans.name: Cesar Ronald

texts.es: Cesar de 26 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijo(3 y 9 años), es agricultor desde hace muchos años, siembra maiz y maicillo actualmente arrienda la tierra donde siembra ya que sus recursos economicos no le alcanzan para poder comprar su propia tierra, el esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas insumos agricolas y poder hacerse de su propia tierra para sembrar sus semillas y darle una mejor vida a su familia y solventar con mas facilidad todos los gastos que se le pueden presentar en su hogar.
texts.en: Cesar is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children (3 and 9 years old). He has been a farmer for many years. He plants corn and sorghum. Currently, he rents the land where he plants his crops, since his economic resources are not sufficient to buy his own land. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy more agricultural supplies and be able to acquire land of his own to plant his seeds, provide a better life to his family, and more easily cover all of the expenses that may arise in his household.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 41 years old and is married. She has a son and lives with him and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has operated a tailor shop at her house for ten years. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of fabric and good quality materials to meet her customers requirements and attract new customers.

She hopes that the loan will help her business run smoothly, and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of fabric and good quality materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy, 40, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a worker at a local company. Thuy started a business of making clothes three years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying fabric and better quality sewing materials to make clothes to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 44 years old and is married with three children, two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nguyet has been running a general store in front of her house for two years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children.  

Nguyet is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili is 25 years old and is married with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, tea bags etc. She has been doing this for four years. 

Saili needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, salt, and boxes of chicken etc to sell in her store. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, tea bags, salt, chicken, soft drinks, soaps etc to sell in her store.

loans.name: Savaliga

texts.en:
Savaliga is a 52 year old married woman with two children. She makes ice-cakes and sells them in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Savaliga needs a loan to buy bags of sugar and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. 

Savaliga has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and foam cups for her business.

loans.name: Xavier Reinaldo

texts.es:
XAVIER tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en la ciudad de Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

 XAVIER es chofer en un taxi.  Solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para el hogar y mejorar el estilo de vida. La compra la realizará en la ciudad de Chimbo.

El sueño es tener un vehículo propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es poder ser independiente. En el tiempo libre le gusta estudir, informarce por medio de noticias del mundo entero.
texts.en:
Xavier is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother in the city of Chimbo in Bolivar province.

Xavier is a taxi driver. He is requesting a loan to buy a television. 

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy this household necessity and improve their standard of living. He will make the purchase in the city of Chimbo.

His dream is to have his own vehicle. The challenge he faces is being able to be independent. In his free time he likes studying, and informing himself by following the news from all over the world.

loans.use: To buy a television.

loans.name: Asopani

texts.en:
Asopani is a 30 year old married woman with no children. She makes pork buns and sells them in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Asopani needs a loan to buy bags of flour, oil and salt. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. 

Asopani has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and salt.

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en:
Talalelei is a 65 year old married woman with two children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Talalelei needs a loan to buy bags of flour, oil and salt. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. 

Talalelei has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell (cosmetics, food supplements, and personal items)

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 57 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food production business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than 8 years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2012, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like pork, chicken and beef. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like pork, chicken and beef

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru:
Муроджон житель города Руми. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него две малеьнкие дочки и еще недавно родился сын, которому сейчас 4 месяца. В семье Муроджон единственный кормилец, так как дети маленькие и жена не работает.
 Муроджон зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь съёмкой свадебных мероприятий. Он занят в сфере услуг более 8 лет. Камера, которой пользуется Муроджон очень устарела и во время съёмок ему предоставляет неудобства. Муроджон запрашивает кредит для приобретения новой видеокамеры, чтобы улучшить качество своих предоставляемых услуг и тем самым привлечь больше клиентов.
texts.en: Murodjon is a resident of the city Rumy.  He's twenty eight years old, married and has two young daughters and a brand new son who is only four months old.  He is the sole provider for the family since his children are little and his wife doesn't work.  Murodjon earns his living filming weddings and receptions.  This has been his profession for more than eight years.  The camera he uses now is outdated and is not advantageous to use.  Murodjon is asking for a loan to buy a new camera in order to improve the quality of his services which will consequently attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy a new video camera.

loans.name: Shahriboni

texts.ru: Шахрибони 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В 1999 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Шахрибони начала бизнес в животноводстве со сбережений в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 2 овец ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов а также перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шахрибони обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота - овец. В будущем, Шахрибони хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.Мечтает отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Shahriboni is forty three years old, married, and has three children.  In 1999, while searching for a source of income for her family, she started her own livestock business using her savings of 5,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, today she owns two dairy cows with offspring, two sheep and she brings in 10,000 KGS each month from the sale of diary and meat products as well as from reselling animals.  With the goal of further developing her business, Shahriboni has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy additional sheep.  In the future, she wants to expand her herd and her business.  She dreams of remodeling her home.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. Sim owns and operates a rice farming business in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Her earnings from her business mainly goes to daily food, and she saves the remaining to invest in purchasing and sourcing hair for local hairdressers, thus to get additional revenue for her family. She has been doing these two businesses for more than ten years and earns approximately KHR 40,000 each day. Her spouse is also doing the same things as her.

Sim has been with HKL for six loan cycles already, and this will be her first loan with Kiva. She has applied for the loan to source and purchase hair. With the rest of the funds, she will buy a motorcycle for home use. Through the loan, she believes that she can sustain her business and give her children basic necessities as well as a good education.

loans.use: To source and purchase hair for hairdressers

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en:
Foketi is 49 years old and married with 2 children. 

She has a small garden where she grows tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, etc. that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Foketi needs a loan to buy chemicals, a shovel, and fertilizer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Foketi will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, a shovel, and fertilizer

loans.name: Jayna

texts.en:
Jayna is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a small variety store in her community. She is 42 years old and doesn't have children. Despite this, she and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to help finance the education of their niece and nephews. 

Jayna plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers demand. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional of P20,000.00 to buy more stocks of soft drinks, dry goods, frozen foods, noodles, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, dry goods, frozen foods, noodles, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Mery Joy

texts.en:
Mery Joy is 35 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Mery Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Mery Joy runs a retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like slippers, shoes, bags and other goods to sell.

Mery Joy has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as slippers, shoes, bags, etc. 

In the future, Mery Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items like slippers, shoes, bags and other goods to sell

loans.name: Joeris

texts.en:
Joeris is 28 years old, and is married with two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 5,000PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure, for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Christina

texts.en:
Having no other source of income, Maria Christina engages in cooking and selling barbecued meats in her village to help her husband in generating income.

She is 30 years old and was gifted with four children. Two of them are now in elementary education. Being responsible parents, they aim to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. 

In this regard, Maria Christina aims to improve and strengthen the business. She is asking for an additional capital of P12,000.00 to buy pork, chicken heads, intestines, hot dogs and seasonings needed in cooking and preparing barbecued meats for sale. She is hoping that through hard work, she will be able to make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken heads, intestines, hot dogs and seasonings needed in preparing barbecued meat, to sell in her village.

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Luisita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Luisita has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save more money to expand her business and buy a motorcycle for her family and business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Cornelio Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Cornelio Ramon es soltero tiene 28 años de edad, curso el primer año de educacion secundaria, el se dedica a la sastreria; aprendio este negocio e inicio trabajando con su padre, hasta el momento el tiene 5 años de experiencia en dicho negocio.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para comprar una maquina plana que le sera de mucha utilidad para poder confeccionar las prendas que costura. en el futuro quiere tener mas máquinas y asi poder producir mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Cornelio is 28 years old and single. He studied the first year of secondary education. He works as a tailor; he learned this trade and began working with his father. He currently has 5 years of experience in this business. 

He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy a table top sewing machine that will be very useful for him for sewing his garments. In the future, he wants to have more sewing machines so to be able to produce more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a table top sewing machine.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Esta casada con Rider quien se dedica al transporte fluvial y es padre de sus 03 hijos por quienes se esfuerza en salir adelante y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa la cual fue comprada hace poco tiempo.La actividad que realiza Alejandrina es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, conservas, entre otros, para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su hogar, donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos .Se inició  comprando y vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades con un capital propio hace más de 14 años, y hasta el momento le apoyan sus hijos en la atención.
Antes de tener ésta actividad,  tenía muchas dificultades económicas pues muchas veces el ingreso de su esposo no era suficiente, además ella deseaba sentirse una persona productiva y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar .Ahora, viendo los resultados que sigue teniendo con su negocio desea continuar e implementar  su bodega con mas productos .Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva y está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes .En esta oportunidad solicitara S/1500 soles para la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad como arroz, leches, azúcar, aceites, entre otros, para surtir su bodega y de esa manera mantener la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 39, is a tenacious and hardworking woman who has a strong desire to get ahead.  She is married to Rider, who works in river transportation and is the father of their 3 children.  They work hard to get ahead and provide their children with a better quality of life.  They live together comfortably in their own house, which they bought a short time ago.  

Alejandrina has a business selling groceries and staple consumer products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, preserves, and other products.  She has a store that is set up in her home, where she tends to her customers in a kind and cordial manner.  Her customers are also mostly her neighbors.  

Alejandrina started buying and selling in small quantities with her own capital more than 14 years ago, and her children are currently helping her with her sales.  

Before she had this business she used to have a lot of financial problems, because her husband did not earn enough.  Also, she wanted to feel like a productive person and support her partner with the household expenses.  Now, seeing the results that she continues to have with her business, she wants to continue to stock her business with more products.  

This is her 4th loan with Kiva, and she is happy to know that she has financial support to carry out her plans.  At this time, she is requesting 1,500 Peruvian soles so that she can buy basic consumer products such as rice, milk, sugar, cooking oil, and other products to stock her store.  This way, she will be able to keep her customer's preference.

loans.use: to buy groceries, including: rice, sugar, canned goods, and other products

loans.name: Abelita

texts.en: Abelita is 54 years old and a married and the mother of three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last five years by selling various products. Abelita makes 5,000 Philippine Pesos a month and is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She is a new member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She joined GDMPC and took out the loan as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more quantities of ingredients for her food stall. Aside from her food stall, she also sells sweetmeats and dainties. As a single parent, she works hard to provide income for her family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evangeline hopes to expand her business and have other businesses. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is 41 years old and has four children. Ma. Flor is married and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Flor has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Flor requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Flor has been in the pig-fattening business for 20 years now, and she has borrowed 9 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Flor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rocio De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
ROCIO tiene 45 años de edad es divorciada no tiene hijos, vive con unos familiares en Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

ROCIO es empleada pública. Solicita el crédito para pagar los modulos de la maestria. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar el pago para culminar con la maestria y obtener el título.

El pago lo realizará en Ambato. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar contra cualquier problema que se le presente.
En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con las amigas y pasear.
texts.en:
Rocio is 45 years old, divorced, and does not have children. She lives with some relatives in the province of Chimbo in Bolivar. 

Rocio is a public employee. She is requesting the loan to pay for the units of a master's degree program. With the help of the loan, she will be able to pay the tuition to be able to finish the master's program and obtain the degree. 

She will make the payment in Ambato. The challenge that she is up against is to fight for whatever problem is presented to her. In her free time she likes to get together with friends.

loans.use: to pay for units of a master's degree program.

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.es: Bartolome, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre con muchas ganas de trabajar y deseoso de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por eso es muy dedicado en su trabajo. El esta casado con Mónica quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 02 hijos pequeños.  Batolomé se encuentra instalado cómodamente en su casa propia junto a su familia.La actividad que realiza Bartolome es la venta de pescado fresco que compra por las madrugadas en el puerto de pescadores de la ciudad y lo lleva a su puesto de venta en el mercado central, donde atiende muy bien a sus clientes entregándoles los mejores ejemplares.Se inició en éste negocio hace más de 12 años, trabajando como ayudante en los botes pesqueros de los puertos, luego con un capital propio se decidió a empezar con su propio negocio, dedicándose a la venta , negocio que hasta el momento lo realiza solo.Antes de empezar con su negocio, sus ingresos como ayudante no le alcanzaba para los gastos de su hogar, viendo esta dificultad, se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio.Ahora puede ver que sigue teniendo buenos resultados, por tanto,  tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y realizar envíos a  otras ciudades de su producto pero en mayor volumen.Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva. Está contento de saber que cuenta con el apoyo financiero necesario para continuar con sus planes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de pescados frescos pero en mayor volumen para enviarlo a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Bartolome is 36 years old. He is a man with much enthusiasm to work and wishes to give a better quality of life to his family. For that reason, he is very dedicated to his work. He is married to Monica, who is a housekeeper and mother of their two small children. 

Bartolome comfortably has his own house with his family. The activity that Bartolome does is the sale of fresh fish that he buys in the early hours of the morning in the fisherman's port in the city, and he brings it to his sales stall in the central market, where he attends very well to his customers, giving them the best offerings. He started this business more than 12 years ago, working as an assistant in the fisherman's boats at the ports. Later, with his own capital, he decided to start his own business, dedicated to sales, a business that until now he does by himself. 

Before starting his business, his income as an assistant was not enough for the expenses of his home. Seeing this difficulty, he decided to start his own business. Now he can see that he continues having good results; therefore, he has plans to expand his business and make shipments of his product to other cities but in bulk. 

This is his 5th loan with Kiva. He is happy knowing that he has the necessary financial support in order to continue with his plans. For this opportunity, he is requesting 1800 nuevos soles, which he will invest in the purchase of fresh fish but in bulk in order to ship it to other cities.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es:
Sotero tiene 56 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 10 años de edad; su padre fue quien le enseño a sembrar maíz. A parte de la agricultura también cuida unas vacas; en el tiempo de la zafra realiza las actividades de corta de caña de azúcar y también compra y vende coco. Se levanta a las 3:00 a.m. a darle de comer a las vacas, luego se alista para marcharse a cortar caña, al autobús pasa a las 4:45 a.m. y regresa a las 6:00 p.m.

Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en la ciudad, camina  a pie unos diez minutos para abordar el autobús este recorrido le lleva unos treinta minutos; luego debe trasladarlos en su espalda hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas, foliares, pago de mano de obra y para pagar arrendamiento de 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno para sembrar maíz. Su deseo, es comprar su propio terreno para trabajar y dejarles a sus hijos un lugar donde construir sus casas.
texts.en:
Sotero is a 56 years old man who lives with his partner and their four children. He has been a farmer since he was ten years old. His father taught him how to grow corn. In addition to farming he cares for cows. During the harvest he cuts sugar cane and he also buys and sells chocolate. He gets up at 3am in order to feed the cows. Afterwards he goes out to cut sugar cane. His bus leaves at 4:45 am and returns at 6pm.
The farming supplies that he needs he gets from the city. He walks for ten minutes to catch the bus that takes him on the thirty-minute ride to the city. On the return trip he carries the supplies on his back to his house.
This loan, that he is requesting from the Countryside Foundation, will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, foliar fertilizer, pay for workers and pay for 14,000 square meters of land that he will use to grow corn. His wish is to buy his own land, which he can work and later give to his children so they have places to build their houses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, foliar fertilizer, pay for workers and pay for 14,000 square meters of land that he will use to grow corn.

loans.name: Sonia  Cristina

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 26 años es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo en ventanas provincia de los Ríos

La Ventanilla se llama SOLIDARIO  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto san Gabriel perteneciente al cantón ventanas esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Sonia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz además a la crianza de  cerdos. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de fertilizantes abonos y fertilizantes y balanceados de engordo y crianza para los animales.

El sueño  es tener dinero para incrementar el negocio de cerdos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta me dedico hacer la limpieza de la casa y pasar con la familia haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
Sonia is 26 years old and married. She lives with her husband and child in the “Windows of the River” Province.
Her town, called Solidario, is located in the precinct of San Gabriel in the Ventanas Canton. The main occupations of the people in her town are farming and fishing.
Sonia works in agriculture. She grows corn and raises pigs. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer, manure and food to fatten and raise her pigs. Her dream is to have enough money to grow her business of raising pigs.
In her free time she likes to clean her house and play sports with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and food to fatten and raise her pigs.

loans.name: Hector Samuel

texts.es: Don Hector ha sido agricultor por varios años, se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijol y maicillo, vive con su esposa que tiene un pequeña tienda y con sus 5 hijos (10,13,19,20 y 24 años) todos depende de él,con  la venta de estos granos logra solventar todas sus deudas como lo es el pago del arrendamiento de tierra donde actualmente esta cultivando, el cliente solicita el credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas y poder comprar su propia tierra ya que con el cultivo logra sacar a delante a su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Hector has been a farmer for many years. He grows corn, beans and sorghum. He lives with his wife, who has a small store, and his five children (10.13.19, 20, 24 years old).  His whole family is dependent upon him. Growing these grains helps him pay his debts such as the rent on the land that he uses to grow his crops. He is asking for this loan in order to buy agricultural supplies and to buy his own land so that, with the sale of his crops, he can help his family progress.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Severina

texts.es: La Sra. Severina tiene 57 años, tiene un hijo ya independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de comida almuerzo en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de San Jose,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Severina va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor, como abarrotes y hortalizas para la elaboración de sus platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de insumos,  la Sra. Severina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar la  sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de su puesto de venta para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo, la Sra. Severina es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Mrs. Severina is 57 years old and has a son that supports himself. She sells prepared lunches from a stall that is located in San Jose. This is her first loan from this institution. Mrs. Severina is going to use this loan to buy supplies wholesale. She will buy groceries and fresh vegetables to be used in her prepared dishes. The reason that she is requesting this loan is the she doesn’t have cash to buy supplies. Mrs. Severina has challenges with her business such as the climate and competition from others that make prepared food. Therefore she needs to reduce her costs and improve the condition of her food. She is going to use the loan to buy utensils and also to increase the size of her stall in order to accommodate more customers during the busiest lunch hours. Mrs. Severina is a hardworking woman who is grateful for the opportunities that are provided by this loan.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods such as groceries and fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Abel Ulises

texts.es:
Abel tiene 56 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de vacas lecheras desde hace varios años; su padre fue quien le enseño. A pesar de estar lisiado de un pie; eso no le impide trabajar muy fuerte, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. a ordeñar sus vacas junto a su esposa y a sus hijos. Luego se va junto a su esposa a trabajar en los 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y sus hijos se van para la escuela. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres vacas lecheras. Así tendrá más producción de leche, por lo que podrá disponer de más leche para la venta y obtener más ingresos económicos que le permitan construir una casa digna; ya que en donde vive esta muy deteriorada ya que se moja y esta en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Abel is 56 years old, married, with five children. He is a farmer and also raises milk cows. His father taught him this trade when he was young. In spite of a weak leg, this does not stop him from working hard. He gets up at 4:30am in order to milk his cows along with his wife and children. Later he goes out with his wife to work on the 14,000 square meters of land that is planted in corn. Meanwhile, his children go to school.
This loan, which is being requested from the Countryside Foundation, will be used to buy three milk cows. This will give him a greater production of milk. He will have more milk to sell and will earn more income. This will allow him to build a proper house, as the house where his family lives is deteriorating. There are leaks and it is in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy three milk cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sell

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en: Remalyn aged 45 lives with her family in Sta. Ana. She is hard-working and friendly. Remalyn is involved in the fish vending business. It is a business that provides a good income. Now, she needs to increase the quantity of fish she offers, thus she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP that she will use to buy fish. Through this loan, she believes that she can make improvements in her business and she is hoping that she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is a fifty-year-old mother of seven. She weaves coconut leaves for roofing material and sells coconuts to earn income. Her husband is a retired teacher. Alice's business faces the challenges of low demand and a poor market in the local community. 

Alice's favorite part of joining the microforestry program is that "KOMAZA is giving us the knowledge of planting trees." With the profits from her tree farm, she plans to buy a plot and build rental houses.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, and training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 54 years old and has three adult-aged children. Despite being a widow, she has the strong determination to improve their standard of living and give her children a better life. She is involved in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through patience and hard work, she believes that someday, she will make more improvements in the business as well as their quality of living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta works hard to support her family. Marieta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marieta requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like spices, vegetables, soft-drinks, sugar, cooking oil, etc,. to sell.

Marieta has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Marieta would like to save more money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like spices, soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store. Editha is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Acleston

texts.en:
Acleston is 37 years old resident of Katale Mayanja and married to Christine.  Together they have four kids. However, he looks after his late brothers children who live with him as his own family.

He started his business of piggery in 2001 as a way to earn an income, support his family and educate his children as well as his late brother’s orphans. 
He has managed this business for a long time due to the experience he acquired while he was still living with his father in the village. The business has helped him take care of his family needs and improve his life's living quality.

Acleston has a dream of expanding his small farm to a medium sized farm in the future so that he can increase his income and productivity on a large scale, since the market is wide. He therefore took the money to finish up his house so that he can be able to reduce his expense for renting.

His major challenge is inadequate capital to expand and at the same time buy feed, more pigs to increase their number on his farm and meet the family's needs.

His neighbors commend Acleston as very hardworking, determined and a dedicated ambitious farmer.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish his house

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 53-year-old woman who is married with six children. She buys and sells fish to make a living. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to add to her stock of fishes to offer.  In the future, Teresita hopes that she can improve her income with her loan requests so that she can provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fishes to offer.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 43 years old and has three children. Viola is married and has one child who is in school.

Viola is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Viola requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Viola has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to sustain it.

Viola would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 60 years old and widowed with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business of making nipa hut (native roofs) for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She would like to purchase additional materials for making native roofs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making native roofs.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is a 33-year-old general store trader in Mariakani,Kenya. She is married and her husband earns additional income, and together they support four people in their family. She has been in this business for the last five years and she has done great.

This marks her third loan from KADET LTD, and has paid the previous loans successfully.  With this loan she will purchase her general store stock of Wheat flour,maize flour,cooking fat, sugar, and milk for sale.

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to be a successful business lady in future.

loans.use: to purchase her general store stock of Wheat flour,maize flour,cooking fat, sugar, kerosine and milk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is borrowing 29,500 PHP which she intends to use to buy fishing nets and other equipment. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide her additional capital for building and expanding her business operations.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Agaitafili

texts.en: Agaitafili is a 28-year-old married woman and has one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Agaitafili has requested a loan to buy chemical fertilizer and weed killers, a wheelbarrow, gloves, bush knives and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Agaitafili hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, weed killer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva has been operating her fish-vending business for more than four months. To further support the needs of her family, she is patiently selling fish. For the business, she needs additional working capital to maintain it and continue earning a good income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase a variety of fishes. She wishes for continued growth of the business to give a better way of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fishes.

loans.name: Sairakan

texts.ru: Сайракан 49 лет, замужем, имеет трех детей. Основная деятельность семьи Сайракан – животноводство и полеводства. В 2011 году, Сайракан решила заняться откормом и перепродажей скота с 70,000 KGS начального капитала. На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Сайракан насчитывающее три дойные коровы,1 лошадь которые приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайракан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Сайракан планирует направить на дальнейшее расширение своей деятельности.
texts.en: Sairakan is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. The main business of her family is animal husbandry and crop growing. In 2011, she decided to get into the area of fattening and re-selling cattle with a start-up capital of 70,000 Kyrgyzstan som (KGS). Today, her farm consists of 3 dairy cows and 1 horse and brings in a monthly income of 15,000 som. For the purpose of further developing her farm, Sairakan has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 115,000 som to purchase cows. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to invest in future expansion her business.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Kulnara

texts.ru: Кулнара 48 лет, разведена. Образование средне-специальное занимается торговлей мужской и женской одежды на центральном рынке. Мать 4 детей. Ей цель жизни, это улучшить жизненные условия, обучить детей в хорошем университете и конечно же расширить бизнес. Кулнара очень добрая, общительная, умная и шустрая. Кулнара начала свой бизнес в 1995 году начальная сумма вклада составляла 1,000 KGS. На сегодняшний день Кулнара имеет 70.000 KGS в обороте. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота за счет увеличения ассортимента товара. На доход полученный от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Kulnara is 48 years old, divorced, and has 4 children. She was educated in a vocational high school. She now sells men's and women's clothing at the central market of her city. Her goal in life is to improve her living conditions, to send her children to a good university, and of course to expand her business. She is very kind, sociable, intelligent and energetic. She began her business in 1995 with a start-up capital of only 1,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Today, she has a turnover of 70,000 Som. For the purpose of further developing her business, Kulnara has now approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 Som to increase her turnover by expanding her range of goods. She will use the income generated by this loan for the future development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase goods to increase the assortment

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 31 years old and has one child. She is married, and her child is in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been in the pig fattening business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times to sustain it.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is 27 years old and married with 1 child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chicken, sugar, flour, salt etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. Imeleta needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, salt, boxes of chicken, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, salt and other items for her store.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.
Pilar successfully paid back her previous Kiva loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
NWTF is re-listing Pilar's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Maria engages in hog-raising to supplement her husband’s income. She is 56 years old and was blessed with five children. She and her husband aim to become successful in life in order to give their children a bright future. For this reason, Maria planned to raise more pigs to sell but she has insufficient capital. She is asking for an additional of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and more piglets to raise. Through patience and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to improve more of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her early 30s, is a single woman with two children (a boy and a girl) who are in school. For a period of five years now, Tatu has been managing her family expenses by running a grocery hut selling fruits and vegetables. She says that it is a good business to be in. She works from 07am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month.

This will be her 4th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which paid back successfully, she managed to increase her store inventory. With the profits earned she covered school fees and family expenses. She will use this loan to buy more genge (grocery hut) stocks. Tatu dreams to buy a plot of land and build a nice house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "TOPI" which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more genge (grocery hut) inventory.

loans.name: Anarkhan

texts.ru: Анархан , 1957 года рождения, не замужем, детей не имеет, образование высшее.  В ведении хозяйства и бизнеса помогает брат. Анархан  обращается в наш банк двенадцатый раз. Все предыдущие кредиты использованы по назначению и погашены в срок, без нарушений. За время оформления документов заемщица показала себя с хорошей стороны, как человек ответственный и предприимчивый, умеющий правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать средства по назначению, среди соседей, коллег и знакомых имеет авторитет, характеризуется как человек отзывчивый и доброжелательный. Сама заемщица работает в управлении социального фонда на должности – ведущего специалиста и имеет стабильную зарплату. Свой бизнес клиент начинал 1996 году на накопленные денежные средства в сумме 8 000 сомов. В настоящее время в своем активе имеет 6 голов КРС и наличность в сумме 6 000 KGS. Параллельно с животноводством заемщица занимается полеводством. На земельном наделе мерою 1,40га выращивает хлопок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  закупить скот, засеять хлопок, кукурузу и клевер. А также дома имеет небольшой магазин, но в настоящее время не работает. За счет прибыли от проекта заемщица намерена отремонтировать магазин и возобновить торговлю. Свою деятельность осуществляет на основании своего многолетнего опыта, знает все тонкости своего дела в этой сфере. Многолетний опыт и оптимистичный настрой к жизни, призывает клиента к новым достижениям.
texts.en: Anarkhan was born in 1957 and has a post-secondary education. She is unmarried and has no children. Her brother helps her to run her business. This is the 12th time that Anarkhan has approached our bank for a loan. All her previous loans were used for their intended purposes and were repaid on time without any violations. During her dealings with the bank, she has shown herself to be a responsible and enterprising person, capable of running her business well and investing finances appropriately. She is recognised as a person of authority by her neighbours, colleagues and acquaintances, and enjoys a reputation of being approachable and friendly. Anarkhan also has a stable salary from her job as a leading expert for a social fund. She started her farming business in 1996 with her savings of 8,000 Kyrgyzstan Som. Her farm now consists of 6 head of cattle and cash assets of 6,000 Som. In addition to animal husbandry, she grows cotton on a 1.4 hectare plot of land. For the purpose of further developing her business, Anarkhan has come to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 Som to purchase cows and to plant cotton, corn and clover. She has a small home-based shop that is temporarily closed, and she intends to use the income generated by this loan to renovate it and get it running again. Anarkhan has accumulated many years of business experience and knows the ins and outs. Her long experience and her optimistic attitude to life encourage her to achieve new goals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and to prepare for spring field work

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat is kind and smart woman. She is married and has 5 children and 2 grandchildren. She works at the library. Her husband is a director of the Culture Center. Both of them have a small salary. Her children are adults and have their own jobs but Mamlakay’s family needs to add income as they have a big expense. Mamlakat plans to organize her own business with selling food products. She is planning to sell food items in a store which is near to her house. Her neighbors were glad when the heard about Mamlakat’s plan to organize a food items store because the local market is located far from their street. She took the course titled ‘To Get Ahead’ from a woman’s organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 1600 Somoni to buy food items for organizing new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items for her new food market.

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en: Faleupolu is a 44-year-old married woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taros, taamu and others crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Faleupolu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Faleupolu hopes to expand her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, and shovels to use in farming her crops.

loans.name: Moanakiva

texts.en: Moanakiva is a 19-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells bbq in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Moanakiva needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, mutton, sausages and other items. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Moanakiva has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her BBQ food stall.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 30 years old, and a simple fish vendor in her village. She has been in the business for 11 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional capital to buy two boxes of fish. Hopefully, her requested loan will be approved in order make her business more productive. This would allow her to provide the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of fish.

loans.name: Tomua

texts.en: Tomua is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Tomua has requested a loan to buy hooks, nets and other gear. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tomua will extend her house.

loans.use: to buy hooks, nets and other gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.
Emilie has been in this business for 5 years. Emilie earns additional income from a general store.
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.
Emilie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save more money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchse more fish to sell.

loans.name: Asovale

texts.en: Asovale is 45 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. Asovale has requested a loan to buy hooks, nets and other gear. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Asovale will extend her family’s house.

loans.use: to buy nets, hooks and other gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en: Jumagul is 37 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her children are adults. Her husband went to Russia to find a job. He has a small salary. Now, Jumagul’s family needs an additional source of income. Jumagul wants to help her husband. She plans to organize a business of animal husbandry. She took a course titled ‘To Get Ahead’ from a woman’s organization and acquired additional skills about business. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to begin an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married and works hard to support her family.
She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy paints and hardwood for the maintenance of her fishing boat.
Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy paints and hardwood for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 64 years old, and married with six children. Crisanta works very hard to provide for them.
Crisanta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like noodles, cooking oil, soy sauce, canned goods, etc.
Crisanta has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods, bread and other groceries.
In the future, Crisanta would like to save more to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like noodles, cooking oil, soy sauce, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moustapha est un homme marié de 59 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille polygame à Bougouni.
Après l’école coranique, il a tenté plusieurs activités mais sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’après mure réflexion, il décide d’apprendre auprès de son oncle les activités d’achat et de vente de boeufs. Après avoir eu un petit fonds de commerce à travers un frère, il décide de s’installer à son propre compte dans la même activité que beaucoup des membres de son ethnie,à savoir l’achat vente d’animaux notamment de boeufs.
Avec une expériences de plus de 15 ans, il maîtrise son activité dans laquelle il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Après avoir correctement remboursé les sept précédents prêt il est à son huitième prêt. Vu le degré de rotation de son activité il a décidé d’anticiper son prêt précédent. Avec ce nouveau prêt il compte  acheter  13  boeufs.  Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et environs. La vente se fait au marché à bétail de Bougouni. Ses clients sont composés surtout des bouchers et des commerçants en provenance de Bamako. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 175.000 FCFA qui servira en subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, rembourser le prêt et à agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Moustapha is a married man of 59 years and father of four children. He lives with his wife and children in a polygamous family in Bougouni.

After attending Koranic school he unsuccessfully tried his hand at several activities. After serious reflection, he decided to learn the cattle trade business from his uncle. Thanks to a small business fund from a brother, he decided to start his own business in the same field as many members of his ethnicity, namely trading animals, in particular cattle.

With over 15 years' experience, he knows the business well and is much sought after and appreciated.

Having fully repaid seven previous loans, he is now on his eighth loan. Given the degree of turnaround of his business he decided to anticipate the final refund on his previous loan. With this new loan he intends to buy 13 oxen.

He buys in Bougouni and the surrounding area. Sales are held at the cattle market in Bougouni. His customers consist primarily of butchers and traders from Bamako.

With this loan, he expects to achieve monthly profits of 175,000 FCFA which will serve to meet family expenses, repay the loan and expand his business.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Vaaia

texts.en: Vaaia is a 48-year-old married woman with 7 children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu, yams and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Vaaia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Vaaia hopes to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy items needed in caring for her crops.

loans.name: Fiailoa

texts.en: Fiailoa is a 41-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Fiailoa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Fiailoa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow and other items need for caring for her crops.

loans.name: Virginia Piedad

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 26 años es soltero vive con los padres en casa de ellos en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La Ventanilla se llama SOLIDARIO  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto san Gabriel perteneciente al cantón ventanas esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Virginia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz además a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de fertilizantes abonos y balanceados de engordo y crianza para los animales.

El sueño  es tener dinero pata poder comprar mas animales por que eso le gusta.

En los tiempos libres le gusta bailar, y salir con las amigas a caminar.
texts.en:
Virgina is 26 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents at their house in the Ventanas province, in Los Ríos.

The communal bank is called "Solidario" and is located in the San Gabriel precinct in Ventanas.  This communal bank works in the fields of agriculture and fishing.

Virginia makes a living in agriculture, growing corn, as well as raising chickens and pigs.  She will use this loan to buy fertilisers and manure and feed for raising and fattening the animals.

Her dream is to have enough money to buy more animals because she likes this work.

In her spare time she likes to dance and go out for walks with her girl-friends.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure and feed for raising and fattening the animals.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead, she sells charcoal to her neighbors and passersby. She will use the money from this loan to stock her business and purchase 20 sacks of charcoal so that she can have a better income in the near future. 

Mwanasha works 10 hours a day at her post in order to provide better service to her customers. 

Mwanasha is grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing people of limited resources the opportunity to have dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 32-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, running a game named bingo. She has been in this business for two years. 

Angelina needs a loan to buy stuff to use for her bingo business. She will use her profits to expand her business. Angelina joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine and bingo papers.

loans.name: Jhonalyn

texts.en:
Jhonalyn is a 43-year-old, married with three children. She is pleased with her store business, where she sells a variety of products to meet each customer’s demands. She has been running her store for ten years, and she is able to earn about 2,000-3,000 PHP a month. 

She would like to request an additional capital amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional stock such as biscuits, bath soap, shampoo, canned goods and noodles. She knows that the loan will be of great help to increase her sales and therefore allow her to offer a better living to her parents and nephews.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as biscuits, bath soap, shampoo, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income. 

Ernestina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and and its harvest. In the future, Ernestina hopes to expand her farming business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Fialupe

texts.en:
Fialupe is 28 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells elei lavalava (traditional cloth) to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

Fialupe has requested a loan to buy an elei board, brushes etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, paint, a paint brush, paint board and fabric.

loans.name: Mzeona

texts.en:
Mzeona is a 49-year-old woman from a small village of Abasha district. She is married and lives with her husband and 27-year-old son. Her son works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. Mzeona milks the cows and produces cheese, which is sold at a good price locally. Besides, they have two hectares of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest. 

Mzeona requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will be able to expand the cattle and thus increase the cheese production. This will significantly increase the income of the family. With an increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Luisana  Elizabeth

texts.es:
Luisana es soltera vive con los padres no tiene hijos vive en ventanas provincia de los Ríos

La Ventanilla se llama SOLIDARIO  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto san Gabriel perteneciente al cantón ventanas esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Luisana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz además a la crianza de  cerdos y pollos. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de fertilizantes abonos y fungicidas y balanceados de engordo y crianza para los animales.

El sueño  es tener dinero para comprarse terrenos para seguir sembrando

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer la limpieza en el hogar.
texts.en:
Luisana is single and lives with her parents in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos.  She has no children.

The communal bank is called "Solidario" and is located in the San Gabriel precinct in Ventanas. This communal bank works in the fields of agriculture and fishing.

Luisana makes a living in agriculture, growing corn, as well as raising chickens and pigs. She will use this loan to buy fertilisers and manure and feed for raising and fattening the animals.

Luisana's dream is to have enough money to buy land to keep sowing her crops.

In her free time, Luisana likes to do the cleaning at home.

loans.use: fertilisers, manure, fungicides and feed for raising and fattening the animals.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en:
Ilkin is a 24-year-old man living in Parizi village, Bolnisi district with his parents. The family owns a plot of agricultural land where they grow potatoes. They also have four milk cows and four calves. The cows are milked every day to make dairy products which are sold locally at the markets. They also sell calves after they are grown. Ilkin is a very hardworking man and he has been in the agricultural business for six years already. 

He requested loan to purchase more calves. After the calves are grown he plans to sell them at a higher price and gain profit. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and it will increase the income of the family. Ilkin will be able to develop his farming and the increased income will give the family a chance to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase calves and sell them later at a higher price.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Josefina es madre soltera de 59 años de edad, curso 1 año de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos elaborado con barro, inició este negocio con sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 30 años de experiencia en este negocio.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio. En el futuro ella quiere ver su negocio prospero y tener mas mercadería para dejarles como patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Josefina is 59 years old and a single mother.  She completed one year of primary education and now has three children, two of whom are studying.  María makes a living buying and selling pottery.  She started this business with her parents and she now has 30 years experience.

María is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more merchandise to stock up her business.  In the future she wants her business to be more prosperous and to to have more merchandise so that she leave it to her children.

loans.use: to buy pottery.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 47 years old, married with four children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production in the local community to earn living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for her banana production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for her banana production.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and has six children. Delia is married and has four children who are in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Delia has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain it.

Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.
