loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 37 years old, she is married to a farmer and they live happily in a rural community. They were gifted with two children and they want them to become successful and professionals in the future. In this connection, they aim to upgrade their status of living in order to support their children's education. 

Marife plans to raise more pigs for sale but she has not got enough capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional piglets, vitamins and feeds. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, vitamins and feeds.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 43-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu, taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Christina has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, chemicals and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Christina hopes to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, shovels, gloves and bush knives.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and motivation for getting ahead in life, Mwanakombo was able to open up a clothing sales business three years ago. Her store is located in one of the markets in her town, and she works ten hours there each day. 

She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business, including: pants, shirts, blouses, tank tops, shorts, skirts, towels, sheets, underwear, etc. 

Mwanakombo is grateful to Kiva lenders for this opportunity and for their support of hardworking people who desire to have an honest job and make a living.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business, including: pants, shirts, blouses, tank tops, shorts, skirts, towels, sheets, underwear.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a cattle-keeper who buys cattle when they are young, feeds them on special hay for a period of time and when they have gained the expected weight, sells them to either farmers or butchers. He started his business because his parents were in the same business, so it was easier since he had enough experience for the same. 

The purpose of this loan is buy more baby cows for fattening. His customers are people around him. He hopes to expand his business; his challenge is bad weather. He is a hard working person.

In the photo is George with the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is aged 30, is single. She has had a business selling clothes door to door for three years now. Hawa runs her business from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month. 

This will be Hawa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock and has paid back her loan successfully. With the interest earned, she managed to cover her home expenses. She will use this loan to restock her business with more clothes. Her dream is to one day be able to have a nice house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " Bega kwa Bega " which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her business with more clothes.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her grocery store. This has been her business for a long time now and she can see the progress that it is continuously having. She and her husband, who is a government employee, work hard to provide income for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvira dreams that her business will get bigger and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 41-year-old woman from a small village of Samtredia district, West Georgia. She lives with her 10-year-old son and two daughters (15 and 16 years old).  Nino is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Nino milks the cow and produces cheese, which is sold at local markets. Besides, she has 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, where maize is grown. She is a very hard working woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. Nino sells the harvested maize locally. 

She requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will be able to produce more cheese and thus increase the sales of cheese. This will significantly increase the income of the family and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Нурмухамет

texts.ru:
Нурмехамед очень хороший учитель. Он работает в школе своего кишлака. Имеет 30 летный опыт. Он очень любит детей.  Несмотря на маленький доход учителя, работает и преподает ученикам. Нурмехамед трудолюбивый человек. До обеда идёт в школу, а после занимается скотоводством. У него несколько барашек. Из-за хорошего расположения кишлака и местности он решил заняться скотоводством и получить дополнительный доход для проживания. Вот уже несколько лет Нурмехамед разводит овец. Своим дополнительным заработком строит  жилищное помещение и кухню  в своём участке земли. Доход от скота ему помогает в его строительстве. Как говорит Нурмехамед – «хоть и не сразу, но потихоньку от каждой продажи овец трачу на строительство и надеюсь в скором времени смогу достроить комнату и кухню для жены». 
На данный момент Нурмехамед нуждается в дополнительных деньгах.  Он хочет закупить маленьких барашек и корм для них. С этой целью обратился в МДО «Арванд» и надеется, что здесь найдёт поддержку и решения своих проблем.
texts.en: Nurmehamed is a very good teacher.  He works at the school in his village, he has 30 years experience and he loves children.  His small salary notwithstanding, Nurmehamed works and teaches his pupils; he is a hard-working man.  He spends his mornings at the school and in the afternoon he raises livestock.  He has a few sheep.  Because of his good location in the village, he decided to raise livestock and earn extra money on which to live.  Nurmehamed has already been raising sheep for a few years.  With this extra work, he is building a house and kitchen on his plot of land.  The money from his livestock business helps him with his building work.  As Nurmehamed says himself, "not all at once, but little by little the sale of each sheep helps the building project and I hope that soon I can finish the bedroom and kitchen for my wife."  At the moment, Nurmehamed needs extra money.  He wants to buy small lambs and feed for them.  With this goal in mind, he has turned to Arvand and he hopes that he will find support and the resolution to his problems.

loans.use: to purchase of livestock

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 46 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

Emma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en: Fetu is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and yam to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Fetu has requested a loan to buy buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Fetu hopes to extend her family's house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, gloves, bush knives and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гулназ 31 год,детей пока нет. Гулназ в 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода, она начала свой бизнес в розничной торговле швейными изделиями  со стартовой суммой в 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Гулназ сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров на идущий сезон не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Гулназ обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения ассортимента товаров. Доходы от кредита Гулназ планирует вложить в улучшения благосостояния семьи.И мечтает иметь собственных детей.
texts.en:
Gulnaz is 31 years old. She does not yet have children. While searching for new sources of income in 2009, she started her own business in clothing retail with an initial investment of 6,000 som. Thanks to hard work and persistence she was able to develop her business so that it provides her with a monthly income of 20,000 som. 

She does not have an abundance of clothing for the upcoming season. Hence, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 110,000 som loan to purchase an assortment of clothing. She plans to invest the income from the loan in improving her family's standard of living. She dreams of having her own children.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase eggs and chickens for resale

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 37 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Айгуль в течении многих лет работает на пекарне. Но прокормить семью на заработную плату не возможно. Айгул на протяжении 15 лет параллельно занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул ежегодно арендует 3,0 га земли где сажает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение селитры, ГСМ для трактора и семян. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aigul is a 37-year-old wife and mother of four. She has worked in a bakery for many years, but she cannot feed her family on this income alone. Hence, she has also worked in crop farming for 15 years. Her initial investment in this business was 15,000 som. Thanks to persistent work Aigul is able to rent a 3 hectare plot of land where she plants beans. With long-term business development in mind Aigul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for an 80,000 som loan to purchase fertilizer, tractor fuel, and seeds. She plans to use the income from the loan to purchase more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers, tractor fuel, and seeds

loans.name: Crispa

texts.en:
This is Crispa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more hair and beauty products for her salon thus generating more income. She has this business for five years now. She is a widow and she works hard to provide income for her daily needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy beauty products and hair products needed in her salon. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Crispa hopes to have a healthy body and a long life. She dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty products and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en: Tafaoga is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas, taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tafaoga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tafaoga hopes to extend their house.

loans.use: to purchase items needed for the care of her crops.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Vilma aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income. She is 48 years old and has three children. She and her husband aim to become financially stable in order to give their children a bright future. To improve the business, Vilma is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Omer Group

texts.en:
Omer group consists of four ladies from Hodeida, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB.
Shwaya is a 42-year-old married woman and has four children. She is the leader of the group. She has the ability and skills needed to build up her business as a seller of incense and perfumes. She would like to expand her business. Therefore she requested a loan of 15,000 YER to help her buy these materials. She wishes to open a savings account with AMB when she makes a good profit and becomes well-known in market.

loans.use: to help her buy incense and perfumes materials.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and a mother of eight children. Mwanajuma considers herself to be a hard-worker who is responsible and really wants to better herself. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she couldn't go to college and went straight to work at an early age. Now she fights every day to give her children a better future.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit she set up a business making food for sale which she has been running from home for 3 years.
The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business, buying staple goods for production such as maize, wood, wheat flour, gas, matches, plastic bags and griddle pans.

Mwanajuma is grateful for the help that kiva borrowers offer to people with scarce resources so that they can have a way of working with dignity.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for production such as maize, wood, wheat flour, gas, matches, plastic bags and griddle pans to use in food production.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn engages herself in fish selling. Through this occupation, she can help her husband in providing finances for their everyday necessities. She is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy additional fish to offer her customers. Providing variety of fish to the customers will increase her income. She just hopes for further improvement of her business and to be able to save for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to offer her customers.

loans.name: Megi

texts.en: Megi is a 33-year-old woman living in the Bolnisi district with her 42-year-old husband Besik. The family has one milk cow and a plot of agricultural land where they have a vineyard. Megi is milking the cow to make dairy products and Besik is harvesting grapes to make wine. All products are sold locally at the markets and the family gets a small monthly income. They both are very experienced in their fields as they are working at them for 15 years. Megi requested a loan to expand her agricultural business. As she has a plot of unused land she will purchase samples of wine trees, Basik will plant them and grow grapes to make more wine. This will increase the family income and family will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase samples of wine trees.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her desire to succeed, Fatuma has a kiosk in her home. A Kiosk is a small store which sells edible goods in small quantities, such as coffee packets, rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, juice, and soft drinks. Fatuma's routine is to work for about 10 hours per day offering her merchandise.

The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital so that in the not-so-distant future, she can earn a better income. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. Fatuma is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders give to people with limited resources so that they can have decent working conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from crafting items from shells and selling personal products. Estrella is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.
Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to stock her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Chave

texts.en:
Chave has sold chickens for almost ten years. He is 49 years of age, separated for 12 years and blessed with seven children. Three of his children are college graduated; the other two are still studying; one works overseas and the other one is his helper in his business.

Chave sells his live chickens to different municipalities using his vehicle used to transport them. According to him, he is able to sell 900 live chickens every other day because of their affordable price. Chave plans to expand his business and provide dressed chickens. With regards to his goal, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 50,000. He hopes that his business will further expand, so he can earn a better income enabling him to get ahead in life and support his two children that are still studying.

loans.use: additional capital to expand his chicken business.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma lives in Likoni. He is married and has two school-aged children.  He has managed a barber shop at the market for the past year.  Juma started this business as a way of supporting himself since he did not have a job. He had taken beauty courses and then decided to open his own business, which has been very profitable. Today he has many established clients and walk-in customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy equipment for his work such as scissors, combs, shaving creams, dryers, colognes, powders, razors, barber capes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his work, such as scissors, combs, shaving creams, dryers, colognes, powders, razors, barber capes, and other items.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita, 43, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Alex, a collector, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedita operates a buy-and-sell business. She buys biscuits from a wholesaler and then sells them to customers for a profit. She also does a rug-making business for additional income. She also sells frozen and processed foods and has motorcycles for rent. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of biscuits to expand her product inventory.  Mercedita dreams of a continuous success of her business and hopes that her family will always be in a good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 32-years-old and married with 2 children. Genara works very hard to provide for them.

Genara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Genara has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread, soft-drinks and school supplies. 

In the future, Genara would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Because of her spirit of self-improvement and her desire to prosper, Mwanamisi has been selling fruits and green vegetables for two years. She had to start at a very young age to help with the costs of running a home. Her business is in one of the local markets. Mwanamisi works ten hours a day, selling products such as watermelons, bananas, papaya, mangos, melons, coconut and green vegetables. She is glad to do this job as this has been her and her children's lives. Her dream is to provide a better future for her children. Her aim for the loan is to invest it in working capital and stock up her business so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can have a higher income. Mwanamisi thanks Kiva investors for the help they provide to people with little resources so that they can have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her fruit-selling business with fruits such as watermelons, bananas, papaya, mangos, melons, coconut and green vegetables.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Desde hace varios años se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas; sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. a ordeñar sus vacas, luego se dirige junto a su esposo a trabajar en los 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz; a las 12:30 p.m. se regresa a su casa a realizar los oficios domésticos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, abonos, herbicidas, para sembrar maíz. De esta manera, podrá comprar todos los insumos para cultivar a tiempo y podrá tener la certeza de disponer del grano que es parte de su alimentación familiar. Su deseo, es adquirir más vacas lecheras para poder vender la leche.
texts.en:
Reyna is 35 years old and has one son, For some years now she has been making a living in agriculture, having been taught this trade by her parents. She wakes up at 4.30am in order to milk her cows and later she goes to help her husband in their 14,000 square metres of land, where they grow corn. At 12.30pm Reyna returns to the house to do the household chores. 

Reyna is applying for this loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy seeds, fertliser and seeds to sow corn. With the loan, she will then be able to buy all the necessary supplies to grow her crops on time and be sure she will have this grain which is an important part of her family's diet. Reyna's wish is to acquire more dairy cows in order to sell milk.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser and herbicides to sow corn. She will then be able to buy all the necessary supplies to grow her crops on time and be sure she will have this grain which is an important part of her family's diet.

loans.name: Giulliana

texts.es:
Giulliana, de 28 años de edad, es una joven mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser alegre y cordial. Es madre soltera y tiene 04 hijos por quienes se esfuerza en trabajar  y salir adelante. Juntos viven en la casa de sus padres , quienes la apoyan con el cuidado de sus hijos.El negocio que tiene Giulliana es la venta de comidas regionales tales como pollos asados, anticuchos y otros. Todos las tardes instala su mesa en el frontis de su hogar y pone a la venta sus comidas preparadas, además de refrescos, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes  en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos . Se inició hace más de 5 años con el apoyo de sus padres . Además comenta que le gusta su negocio pues conoce de cocina y se decidió a empezar con este negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y asi solventar los gastos de su familia.Ahora viendo los buenos resultados desea ampliarse y abrir una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres.Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva y está contenta de saber que seguirá teniendo acceso a una línea de crédito para continuar con sus planes.
En está oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de ingredientes tales como arroz, azúcar, aceitunas, entre otros para la preparación de sus comidas .
texts.en:
28 year old Giuliana is a hardworking and determined young woman who is also cheerful and cordial. She is a single mother and has 4 children for whom she strives to work and succeed. They live together in her parents' house and her parents help her look after her children. Giulliana has a business selling regional food such as roast chicken, meat kebabs, and others. Every afternoon, she sets-up her table in front of her house and offers her cooked food for sale along with sodas. She looks after her customers very kindly and they are mostly her own neighbors. She began this business more than 5 years ago with the help of her parents. She says that she likes her business as she knows how to cook and that she decided to start this business because she needed her own income so she could cover her family's expenses. Now, seeing the good outcomes, she wants to grow the business and open a grocery store in her parents' house. This is her 5th loan from Kiva and she is know that she will keep having access to a line of credit to  continue with her plans. 
On this occasion, she is requesting $600 to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, olives, and others to make her meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
From the small village of Samtredia district, Sopio is a 32-year-old married mother of a 6-year-old daughter and a 14-year-old son. Her pensioner mother-in-law also resides with the family.

Sopio has two milk cows and four calves whose milk is used to make cheese that is sold at local markets. The family also has a plot of agricultural land upon which a variety of vegetables is grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price.

Sopio has requested a loan to purchase clothing and dishes to resell. This will significantly increase the income of the family, thereby enabling the family to improve their living conditions. Sopio awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and dishes for resale.

loans.name: Melanio

texts.es: El Sr. Melanio tiene 52 años el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Porvenir,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Melanio va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de papa y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, El Sr. Melanio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar,  El Sr. Melanio vende sus productos directamente del productor al consumidor,  es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Melanio is 52 years old and works in agriculture, growing a variety of vegetates such as potato, yuca, and corn on his plot of land which is in the community of Porvenir. This loan is his first with this institution. Melanio is going to use the loan to plant his potato crop and to prepare the land. His reason for requesting this loan is to obtain resources for planting and to live on. Melanio faces challenges in his business which include bad weather that often ruins the crops. He will use the benefits to improve the quality of life for his family as he is responsible for all the household expenses. Melanio sells his produce directly to the consumers. He is a responsible, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution of the help offered.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Gregoria sigue con la actividad de la venta de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de zapatos y botas de invierno, creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de ropa de invierno como chamarras y chompas, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Gregoria continues to make a living selling second-hand clothes and shoes. She says the last loan was good for her as she used it to buy shoes and winter boots. Her business grew, as did her number of customers and, consequently, her income. On this occasion she is applying for a loan to buy winter clothes such as jackets and jumpers. She is happy and grateful for this new opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes such as jackets and jumpers.

loans.name: Karolina

texts.es: Carolina  tiene  24  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, por lo que  solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Karolina is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son.  She plans to use her loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants.  She will also hire laborers.  She plans to care for her coffee plantations so that they don't suffer any damage and so that she doesn't lose crops.  Through her coffee farming, she hopes to make more profits so that she can help support her family.

This is the first loan that Karolina has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received any previous loans from State banks.  FUDECOSUR gave her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Janit

texts.en:
Janit is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business, together with her husband, for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Janit is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  With this, they will be able to improve their farm and its harvest. In addition, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children, and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy additonal fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build commercial premises

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and the mother of six children. She is a hard-working, responsible woman who wants to improve her situation. 

She has worked since she was very young to earn her daily bread. For the last two years, Zawadi has made her living by owning and running a small grocery store. She sells basic household products like basic grains, cleaning products (like soaps and detergents), packaged foods and other products. She currently has the financial support of her husband. 

Zawadi is requesting a loan to strengthen her working capital. Her future goal is to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase of food products like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, detergents, matches, dairy products, and other items as stock for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 33-year old married woman, the mother of a five-year-old son from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business, together with her husband, for more than three years now; this is their source of income. 

Lorna works hard to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and its harvest, thus augmenting their yield and income.

In the future, Lorna hopes to expand their farming business and make it successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 49, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, who is self-employed, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Julieta operates a variety store. 
In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for any item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting her supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the members of her local community. She makes at least PHP 500 of sales every day. She is applying for a PHP 18,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Julieta dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to have a happy and peaceful life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa , esta casada con Miguel quien padre de sus 05 hijos. Ella vive junto a toda su familia en una casa propia .La actividad que realiza Pilar es el alquiler de bicicletas , tiene 3 unidades que están operativas y funcionando. También cuenta con un mototaxi que lo alquila a su vecino y recibe un pago diario.  Tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa donde guarda sus bicicletas y les brinda el mantenimiento, del cual se encarga su pareja.Se inició hace más de 06 años con una bicicleta y viendo la demanda de su servicio, decidió invertir adquiriendo más unidades aunque ahora solo 03 estan operativas , y las otras 06 están en mantenimiento.  En ésta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos y considera a su negocio bastante rentable por los recursos económicos que les deja.
Antes de empezar su negocio propio tenía dificultades económicas ya que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ahora puede apoyarlo y aspirar a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Con las ganancias que tiene de su trabajo espera ahorrar para comprar otra unidad de mototaxi y alquilarlo para así aumentar sus ingresos.Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva y se siente agradecida de contar con un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicita S/.500 nuevos soles, para la compra de respuestos de sus bicicletas .
texts.en:
Pilar, who is 38 years old, is a hardworking and determined woman. She is married to Miguel, the father of their 5 children. She lives with all her family in their own home. 

The activity that Pilar carries out is renting bicycles. She has 3 units operating and working. She also has a motorbike taxi, which she rents to her neighbour. She receives a daily payment for this. She has an area in her house to keep the bicycles. The area has been made suitable for this purpose and it Is also where the bicycles are serviced. Her partner does this job. 

She started this business over 6 years ago with one bicycle. Seeing the demand for the service, she decided to invest by acquiring more units. However, at the moment only 3 are in operation; the other 6 are being serviced.  

Her husband and children support her with the business, which she considers to be sufficiently profitable, given the economic benefits the family gets from it.

Before setting up her own business, she had economic difficulties as her partner’s income was not enough to cover the household bills. Now she can support him and aspire to a have a better quality of life.

With the earnings that she makes from her work, she hopes to save enough to buy a second motorbike taxi. She plans to rent it out and that way increase her income. This is loan number 5 for her with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support, which enables her to advance her business. On this occasion she is requesting S/.500 Nuevos Soles, to buy bicycle parts.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes tiene 51 años, casad tiene dos hijos de las edades de 34 y 30 años  ya independientes, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir para santos, angeles  de las iglesias,  para niños de Navidad y para distintas figuras, se dedica a este oficio desde hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de Mallasilla. Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Mercedes va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión. La Sra. Mercedes enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, La Sra. Mercedes es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 51 years old, is married and has two adult children, ages 34 and 30. She works by making outfits for saints and angels in churches, Christmas children, and other figures. She has done this type of work for several years, and her workshop is in her home, which is in the Mallasilla area. 

This is her first loan cycle with this institution. Mercedes is going to use the loan to buy wholesale fabric to make these outfits. She is requesting this loan to increase her investment capital. Mercedes faces challenges in increasing her business's income. She is going to use her earnings to invest in buying materials to make high quality outfits, which will lead to more clients. Mercedes is a very hard-working person. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the help they offer.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Janet is aiming to improve her hog-raising business to earn a higher income and pay for the education of her children. She is 47 years old and has three school-age children. Despite the hardships of life, they have a strong determination to improve their standard of living. To improve the business, she is asking for an additional capital loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that her loan will help her improve the business and hopes that, some day, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines she needs for raising hogs.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en: Enriqueta is 52 years old, a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Enriqueta has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Enriqueta applied for a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Enriqueta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Enriqueta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 29-year-old married man and the father of one child. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He owns a pharmacy, having completed his studies and earned his diploma. He found it difficult to accumulate enough money to start up his pharmacy, because most of the profit he makes goes to meet his family’s expenses. Therefore, he decided to apply for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to expand his business, and to include new and different kinds of medicines to boost his profits. He looks forward to opening a big pharmacy, which will attract more customers, which will, in turn, result in improving his income.

loans.use: to buy new and different kinds of medicines for his pharmacy and thus to boost his profits.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.en:
Yulduz is a kind and glorious woman. She always tries to improve the living conditions of her family. She is married and has two children. For some years she has been busy with farming but last year she didn’t get a good harvest and that’s why her family is in poverty. She decided to organize a new business with animal husbandry as in the local market there is a great demand for livestock. 

Yulduz studied at the course called ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy cattle to organize a new business. This loan will help her to find a source of income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to organize a new business

loans.name: Syovinya

texts.en:
Syovinya is 33 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has been running her business for a period of about six years with an income of 10,500 KES.

This is her second loan after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to buy animal feed. She hopes to be a leading farmer.

loans.use: to buy  animal feed.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 26-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol, and the mother of two children. She has been engaged in the business of raising hogs for more than eight years. Lydia is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business, thus augmenting her income and her profits. In the future, Lydia hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is hard-working and a business woman. She is happily married with four grown-up children. Three of her children are married while the other one is business oriented. Milagros' earned income goes toward their daily consumption and monthly payment for water and electric bill.

Milagros sells rice and in the evening she sells 'balut' (a Filipino delicacy with eggs) at a bus terminal of Victory liner. She is grateful because she is able to run her business smoothly. This time, Milagros plans to increase the bags of rice she offers and buy sacks of charcoal as an additional source of income. But her capital is no longer enough with regards to this situation, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. She hopes for continuous progress of her rice retailing business so she can satisfy customer demand and have a better way of life someday.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and sacks of charcoal for her retailing business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and the mother of two children. She is the owner of a small grocery store located in her home in the urban center of her community. She has had this business for two years, buying her products from different distributors that come to her community. Her daily routine involves getting up at 6:00 am to open her small grocery store at a very early hour to benefit from and sell to her clients who have to get up and find breakfast to send their children to classes. Then she works until 8:00 pm. 

Fatuma is asking for the loan with the objective of stocking up the grocery store's inventory so that her business will be more productive. Her greatest dream is to be able to expand her business to ensure a good future for her children.

loans.use: to invest in products of daily consumption like: basic grains, sugar, oil, candy and rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Vilma has been in this business for 13 years now and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

Vilma requested a 29,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional box of fish to sell. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread for her bakery

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña lorena de 30 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos (7 y 14 años)su fuente de trabajo es ser agricultora; siembra maiz, frijol y maicillo, con las ventas que hace de sus cultivos ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar, solicita credito para poder comprar insumos y asi seguir cultivando y teniendo mas ganancias de sus ventas y poder tener una mejor vida para ella y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena, 30, lives with her husband and two children (7 and 14 years old). She works in agriculture farming corn, beans, and sorghum. With the proceeds from selling her crop, she's able to pay for the house expenses. 

She will use the credit to buy inputs and continue farming to increase her income from selling. She hopes to have a better life for her family and herself.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Lavrenti

texts.en:
Lavrenti is a 57-year-old man. He lives in Melauri village, Samtredia district, with his 54-year-old wife, Nani, and 28-year-old son, Amiran. Amiran is working as an artisan on private orders earning a small monthly salary. The family owns a small plot of agricultural land where they grow different kinds of vegetables. They also have three milk cows and three calves. Lavrenti cultivates the land and harvests vegetables. Nani milks the cows to make cheese. All the products are sold locally at the market and the family makes a small monthly income. 

Lavrenti requested a loan to purchase a milk cow so they will be able to make more cheese and sell it locally. This will increase the family profit. Lavrenti plans to use part of the profit to expand their farming and another part to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Yelba Meyling

texts.es:
Yelba una humilde señora  de 45 años, originaria de Managua, soltera, madre de 1 hijo, mayor de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y tortillas, debido a su condición económica  solo logro finalizar su quinto año de secundaria. Ella inicio con su pequeño negocio a los 19 años de edad, necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y poder ser independiente generando ingresos por si misma. Sus comienzos fueron difíciles porque empezó vendiendo poquita ropa y zapatos, pero luego decidió emprender otro negocio como es la venta de tortilla, para obtener otros ingresos extra. Actualmente ella junto a su hija han logrado mantener el negocio estable, ya que con las ganancias que le genera este negocio ha podido mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Cuenta con otros ingresos como es la remesa que le manda un hermano. 
Yelba  esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar chinelas, short, trajes de baño y a la misma vez comprar maíz y leña. Ella estima que este préstamo le  será de mucha ayuda porque le permitirá  comprar todos los productos que aun no tiene  en inventario con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Yelba is a humble lady, 45 years old. She is from Managua. She is single and a mother with one child, who is an adult now. She works in sales, selling clothes and tortillas. 

Due to her economic situation she was only able to complete her 5th year of secondary education.

She started her small business at 19 years old. She needed a way to support herself and to be independent, with a means of generating income herself. At the start it was difficult because she sold very few clothes and shoes. Then she decided to set up another business selling tortillas in order to earn some extra income. At present, together with her daughter, they have managed to keep the business stable. 

The earnings she has made from the business have enabled her to make improvements to her house. She has other sources of income, such as money that one brother sends her.

Yelba is requesting this finance to buy flipflops, shorts and swimsuits, and also to buy corn and firewood. She considers that the loan will be of great help to her because it will enable her to buy all the products that she does not have in stock, with the aim of increasing her sales and meeting her customers’ needs. Her future plans include expanding her business to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy flipflops, shorts and swimsuits, and also to buy maize and firewood

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia, de 45 años de edad, esta casada con Alejandro quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus hijos. Juntos viven en la casa que compró con ayuda de su esposo.La actividad que realiza Adilia es la venta de pescado frescos , loc cuales compra en el puerto de su localidad para luego llevarlos a vender en su puesto de venta en el mercado de la ciudad, atendiendo de manera amable y atenta a sus clientes .Se inició hace más de 05 años con un capital propio, pero antes de empezar con su negocio sufría muchas  dificultades por la escasez de trabajo, además le gusta su negocio porque genera sus propios ingresos y asi logra apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de hogar , por tanto, ahora viendo los ingresos obtenidos desea ampliar y seguir creciendo, además quiere abrir una tienda de lubricantes en casa. Este es el préstamo número 4 con Kiva. Por ello está agradecida con su colaboración para  concretar sus planes. En esta oportunidad solicitara 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de su mercadería en este caso el pescado fresco y otras materiales que le sirven para la venta.
texts.en:
Adilia, 45, is married with Alejandro who works in transportation and is the father of her children. Together, they live in the house she bought with her husband's help. Adilia sells fresh fish, which she buys in the local port and then sells from her spot in the city market. She caters to her clients in a kind and attentive manner. 

She started more than 5 years ago with her own capital. Before starting with her business, she suffered many difficulties due to lack of a job. She likes having her own business because she has own income and can help her partner with the house expenses. She wants to increase her income and continue growing, eventually opening an automotive lubricants store in her house. 

This is her 4th loan with KIVA. She's very thankful for its aid in helping her achieve her plans. She's requesting 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy her merchandise, in this case, fresh fish and other materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, a dentist whose previous loan was a big help in buying more medicines and other supplies for her dental clinic. With 20 years in the business, Mary Grace has established a good name in her community and is patronized by the people in the community. She and her husband, who is also a dentist, are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Mary Grace is requesting a new loan for 50,000 PHP to buy an additional stock of supplies, materials and medicines needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Grace hopes that her business will continue its success, and dreams of giving her children a good life and future. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* partners to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of supplies, materials and medicines needed in her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a personal products business in the Philippines and also earns income from selling food and a manicure businesses. Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF.

Analyn is borrowing 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more personal products like perfume, body lotion and shampoo for resale. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products like perfume, body lotion and shampoo for resale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 61-year-old woman from the Samtredia district.  She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.  

Marina is involved in the agricultural business.  In particular, she has four milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production.  Marina milks cows and produces cheese to sell at local markets.  Besides this, she has a plot of land, where 50 nut trees and maize are grown.  Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest.  She sells approximately 150-200 kg of nuts and 300-400 kg of maize seasonally.  In addition, Marina owns a tractor, which is used for tilling.  She has requested a loan to renovate a tractor. After the tractor is renovated, she will rent it out and earn money from it. This will significantly increase the income of her family.  With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a tractor and rent it out.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is married and has two children. He’s from Likoni, a place in Mombasa.  He is noted for being a very hardworking, kind, respectful person. 

His primary economic activity is a grocery store located at home. He’s been in this business for one year. This type of store is one that sells items like rice, beans, sugar, coffee packets, shampoo packets, bread, milk, oil, eggs and detergents in small quantities.  The objective of the loan is to act as working capital so he can stock the business in order to improve sales and meet customer demand. The business arose because he needed a source of family income. 

Salim is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources so they can have a dignified source of employment.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 65 years old and married with four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She raises pigs for sale. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. Paulina joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase pig feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna and her husband are both farmers who live in a rural community. She is 49 years old and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, she is involved in the hog-raising business to earn additional income. She planned to raise more pigs to sale but she did not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P10,000.00 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising. She is hoping that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy the feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising.

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en: Olympia is a 52-year-old married woman and the mother of 10 children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in a retailing business selling cosmetics and other beauty products. She is also involved in food vending and a farming business. Olympia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and additional stock to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and additional stock to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 60 years old and widowed with two children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, she is running a retail business in the local community. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 54, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Marilou operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Marilou dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to give her children a good quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Francisca Jamileth

texts.es:
Francisca, 35 años de edad, originario  de Boaco, pero actualmente vive en Managua, padre de 2 hijos  de 13 y 15 años   de edad  respectivamente, de oficio comerciante,  se dedica a la venta de comida, del que es propietario hace más de 1 año. Inicio su actividad laboral a la edad de 34 años con capital propio, ya que ella  necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y poder salir a delante  con su familia, fue allí que decidió emprender su propio negocio como es la venta de comida, ella se siente muy satisfecha  porque este negocio le genera ganancias a diario, recibe el apoyo de su compañero en su negocio, cuenta con otros ingresos como es la remesas que le envían familiares del extranjero. 
Francisca  está solicitando el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne y al mismo tiempo  1 vitrina. El estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar su exhibidor de comida, con el propósito de atraer mas cliente para obtener mejores ganancias, dentro de sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio para darle una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Francisca, 35 years of age, originally from Boaco but currently living in Managua, parent of 2 children who are 13 and 15 years old, works as a vendor engaged in food sales, and has been a proprietor for more than a year.

She began her work activity at the age of 34 years with her own capital, as she needed a way to survive and bring up her family. So she decided to start her own business selling food. She feels very happy because the business brings in money daily. She has the help of her partner in the business, and from other proceeds and other remittences sent from relatives abroad.

Francisca is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat and at the same time one display case. She thinks that this loan will help her buy a food showcase and has the idea of attracting more customers in order to get higher earnings. In the future she plans to improve the infrastructure of her business in order to create a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat and one display case for her food

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost his business. His goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his grocery store so that he can satisfy his customers. He wants to purchase rice, beans, bread, milk, juice, matches, eggs and soda in small quantities. In the near future, he would like to be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his grocery store with products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, juice, matches, eggs and soda.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 26 years old, married and has two children. The family lives at Amulung. To provide sustenance for the family, Alberto provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. He usually gains about PHP 5,000 each month and he wants to keep improving transport services and earn more income. For this, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy crude oil and maintain his motorcycle. This will help improve the safety of all his passengers. 

Someday, Alberto hopes to generate enough income to have savings for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Roque is 57 years old, widowed, and has 6 children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, he manages a fishing business in the local community. He has been in his business for over 6 years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, tiene la edad  de 55 años, está divorciada,  vive sola  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar gallinas ponedoras. Ella tiene pensado comprar estas gallinas con el anhelo de vender huevos a los vecinos y en algunas pulperías,  para obtener buenas ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old. She is divorced and at the moment is living on her own. 

She is hoping to buy laying hens with this loan. She plans to buy these hens in order to sell the eggs to local people and in some grocery stores. In this way she can earn a better income, improve her quality of life and achieve economic stability. 

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not taken out a loan with a government bank before. However, FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better facilities and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy laying hens

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en: Ranilo is a 33-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He has been rice farming for more than 2 years now. This is the source of their income. Ranilo is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his business and augment his earnings from it. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and  pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Sokoroti Ole

texts.en:
Sokoroti, now 46 years old, has paid off his previous loan owing to the bumper wheat harvest of the past season. He has used some of the proceeds to lease a bigger portion of land as well as added some numbers to his cattle herd.

Sokoroti has been advanced another loan by KADET Ltd. of 50,000 Kenyan shillings which will facilitate the purchase of wheat seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides in preparation for the upcoming planting season. He hopes to enlarge his farming activities from the increased proceeds. His hope is to own and manage a large wheat plantation for commercial purposes.

loans.use: to cultivate the land for the next planting season.

loans.name: Luis Elvis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasar tiempo en su pequeña parcela y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Pachamanca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como chofer, brindando servicios de colectivos en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general, pintado y compra de llantas para su vehículo, de esta manea el podrá seguir atendiendo a sus clientes, así pues Luis seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de sacar adelante su pequeña parcela donde desea sembrar  pecana.
texts.en:
Luis is a 28 year old man. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his wife and his two young children, whom he loves and they are his reason for living. He is a very friendly person, hardworking and enthusiastic. He and his wife put all their efforts together to bring up the family. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and the need to work from an early age, Luis could not study in the field of agriculture. In his free time he enjoys spending time on his small plot of land and sometimes he cooks a tasty barbecue to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Luis works as a driver, providing a taxi service in his town. He works every day for about ten hours and thinks that it is going well because he knows the areas where there is high customer demand.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the provided help he can do general maintenance, painting and buying tires for his vehicle, so he can continue serving his customers, and so he can continue working and striving towards his big dream of moving ahead growing pecans on his small plot of land.

loans.use: to do routine maintenance, painting and buying tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Sabeth

texts.en:
Sabeth is 60 years old and married with three children. She is a farmer in Kangundo town where she sells cash crop produce from her farm. These include maize, beans and vegetables. She has been in the farming business for four years now and it has been profitable.

This is Sabeth's second loan term and she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings in preparation for the planting season. She anticipates making more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her farming business by planting more cash crops on a large scale, so she can make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 36 years old. She lives in Gardabani district with her 47-year-old husband, Merab. The main source of income for the family is farming. They have milk cows. Nino milks the cows to make dairy products which are sold locally at the markets and the family makes a small monthly income. In addition, Merab is working for a private company as a driver.

Nino requested a loan for purchasing calves. She plans to buy five calves at a good price, grow them and later sell them with a price markup. This will increase their income and Nino is planning to use the profit for renovating the cattle shed. The family income will grow and they will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase five calves

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам житель района Шахринав. Ему 48 лет. У него жена и трое детей. Жена Рустама домохозяйка, а дети учатся в школе. Рустам занимается выращиванием овощей. Однако сейчас он хочет начать новый бизнес. Его интересует животноводческая деятельность, так как это прибыльное дело и не требует больших усилий. К тому же у Рустама во дворе есть сарай для скота и в местности, где он живет очень хорошие условия для содержания скота. Поэтому Рустам, приняв решение обратился за кредитом. Он берет кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. В дальнейшим за счет прибыли он планирует сделать ремонт в сарае для скота.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the Shahrinav region. He is married to a homemaker and has 3 children who are in school. He works growing crops, but now wants to start a new business. He is interested in getting into animal husbandry as this is a profitable field that does not require a lot of effort. Moreover, Rustam has a barn on his property and the surrounding area is very conducive to raising cattle. For this reason, having made his decision, he is now seeking a loan so he can buy and sell cattle. In the future, he plans to use the income generated by this loan to renovate his barn.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina has operated her general store for seven years. She is 46 years of age, married to a farmer, and has three children. Aside from the general store, she is also engaged in a farming and livestock business.

Cristina would like to buy grocery items such as instant noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, and other kinds of groceries for her general store. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000. She hopes to obtain this amount so she can improve her financial stability and have a better way of living. Cristina is looking forward to the approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as instant noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, and other kinds of groceries for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy auto repair tools for an auto repair business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Doña Alejandra una humilde señora,  de 34 años de edad, originaria de  León, pero actualmente vive en  Managua,  madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 5 y 11 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, de la  que es propietaria hace mas de 12 años. Inicio en el ámbito del  comercio, con capital propio, dinero que le dio su compañero, para que pudiera emprender su propio negocio como es la venta de tortilla,  con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo  ha podido salir adelante y  mantener su negocio  estable.
Doña Alejandra esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar maíz y leña. Con el objetivo de comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus tortillas,  dentro de sus planes futuros es  mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra is a simple woman, 34 years old, and a native of Léon although she now lives in Managua. She has two children aged 5 and 11. She earns her living selling tortillas, a business she has owned for more than twelve years. Alejandra started her business using money that her husband gave her for that very purpose. With a lot of hard work and effort she has managed to get ahead and now has a solid business. 

She now requires a loan to buy corn and firewood and all the basic supplies she needs to make tortillas. Her plans for the future include improving the building where she makes the tortillas and providing a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is married and has children who attend school. She sells paraffin – a business she runs from her home. She has two years of experience running this business. She created this business due to a lack of sources of stable work and in order to generate income and help pay for the household expenses. 

Currently, Tima needs to amass some working capital to buy 20 litres of paraffin from the distributors to offer her clients and improve her income. Tima is grateful for the help Kiva investors give those with limited resources in order to have sources of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy 20 litres of paraffin

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 20 years old and from the small village of Telavi district, East Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, infant child, parents-in-law, and daughter-in-law. Mariam requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family's business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the small monthly income of Mariam’s husband, working as a hired worker in a local wine factory. Mariam’s mother-in-law is working in the same wine factory as a laboratory assistant. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mariam requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business, which was stopped because of natural calamity in the Kakheti region. Her loan request was approved under a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisage provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with conditions suited to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Mariam will start a grocery store. She will roof the grocery store, which was damaged, and will buy grocery stock. Mariam is experienced in this business, as she has a grocery store, and she thinks that it will be profitable. The profit will be reinvested in the business, and she will be able to make a better future for her infant child. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to roof the grocery store and purchase a grocery stock

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en: Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her drive to get ahead, Faiza runs a business. She has owned a hardware store for a year, and it's located in a specific spot of her town. Faiza's daily routine is working about 10 hours a day offering her services. She runs this business with great pleasure, so that in a not-so-distant future she'll be able to improve her profits. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with hardware such as zinc, cement, beams, nails, iron, wire, paint, screws, brushes, and PVC pipes.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, cement, beams, nails, iron, wire, paint, screws, brushes, and PVC pipes

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un  célibataire de 22 ans et sans enfants qui vit chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Il n’a pas fréquenté le système scolaire, dès son jeune âge il suivait les animaux c’est à dire l'activité du berger auprès de son père au village près de Bougouni.
Quelles années plus tard il décida  de quitter le village afin de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus  notamment à la vente d’articles de la boutique.  Avec 6 année d’expérience, il maîtrise cette activité. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après deux prêts tous correctement remboursés, il est à son troisième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter 2 sacs du sucre, 6 cartons de thé, 4 cartons de cigarettes  et 5cartons de savons. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali et à Bougouni.
Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale. Avec ce prêt, Yaya compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage toujours agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
