Mr. Yaya, age 22, is a single man without children who lives in his father’s home in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. He never attended school. He became a sheperd at a young age alongside his father in the village near Bougouni.

After a few years, he left the village to undertake income-generating activities such as the sale of various staples. With six years of experience, he now has a good command of his activity. 

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Having obtained and correctly repaid two loans, he is now seeking a 3rd loan to buy two bags of sugar, six boxes of tea, four cartons of cigarettes and five boxes of soaps. He buys his merchandise in 
Bougouni and in Bamako, capital of the Republic of Mali. His client base is composed of locals. 

With this loan, Yaya expects to earn a monthly profit of 30,000FCFA. He plans to use his profits to expand his store.

loans.use: to stock up on staples for his store.

loans.name: Yasmin America

texts.es:
Yasmin, tiene una venta de antojitos, Ella tiene 31 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos sus edades son de 2, 3 y 5 años, su esposo no está junto con ellos pero les ayuda con sus gastos.
Su venta de comida engloba lo que son pupusas, pasteles, enchiladas; tiene 3 años de poseer el negocio y lo aprendió con una amiga. El crédito le será de mucha utilidad y  servirá para comprar quesillo, maíz, arroz, chicharrón, leña, aceite, etc.
Con la inversión podrá obtener incrementar en sus ingresos y obtener más inventario. También le permitirá fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yasmin has a stall selling snacks. She is 31 years old and has three children, aged two, three and five years old. Yasmin is not in a relationship with her husband but he helps with costs for the children.
At her stall, Yasmin sells tortillas, cakes and enchiladas. She has had the business for three years and learned the trade with a friend. The loan will be very useful for Yasmin and will be used to buy cheese, corn , rice, pork scratchings, firewood, oil and more.
With this investment, she will be able to increase her income and her stock. It will also allow Yasmin to strengthen further her business and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn , rice, pork scratchings, firewood, oil and more.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 30 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora que de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación primaria y dependen de ella en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene grado de educación de primaria completo pero por falta de apoyo económico ella no pudo seguir estudiando ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos y lo que ellos producían lo lograban distribuir sabiamente para que ella pudiese aprovechar a sacar la primaria completa. Desde muy joven ella aprendió a cultivar café ya que  fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Junto a su esposo se dedican a este rubro siendo el, el único que se involucra en: la limpieza, poda y fertilización por lo cual no pagan mano de obra. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 5 años y el terreno donde tienen sus cultivos es propio el cual lo obtuvieron como herencia por parte de los padres del esposo mismo que está a una distancia de dos kilómetro de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante, abonos para el cultivo de café ya que el producto que utilizan para sus cultivos es caro y lee es difícil adquirirlo. 

Su meta es que sus cultivos sigan produciendo más y se mantengan sanos para poder obtener mejores ganancias y de esa forma poder re invertir en sus cultivos ya que es el único medio de ingreso y sustento para su familia. Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijos graduados a nivel universitario para que ellos tengan un mejor estilo de vida, mejores ingresos y puedan aprovechar el esfuerzo que hoy en día sus padres hacen con la tierra misma que sera heredada a ellos en un futuro para crear empresas o negocios que generen empleo a otros.
texts.en:
30-year old Marta is married and has three children who attend primary school and rely on her for everything. She is hardworking and enterprising. Marta completed her primary school education but she couldn’t afford to continue her studies since her parents are poor. Whatever they produced, they managed to use wisely so she did complete primary school. 

As a young girl Marta learned about growing coffee from her parents who taught her how to look after the land. Now she and her husband work as coffee farmers; he is the only person who helps her with weeding, pruning, and fertilizing, so they don’t pay any labourers. Marta has been a farmer for more than five years. The land they work is their own as they inherited it from her husband’s parents. It’s located about two kilometres from their house, and they walk there every day.

Now Marta is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for the coffee plants as the product they use is expensive and difficult to acquire. Her goal is to have her fields produce more and keep the plants healthy so that she can earn more money. Then she will be able to reinvest in the coffee fields; this is the only means she has of earning money to support her family.

Marta’s dream is to see her children graduate from university so that they can have a better standard of living, more income, and benefit from the effort that their parents put in today on the land. This is the land that they will one day inherit and can use to create companies and businesses to generate employment for others.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee plants

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: martine est une mère au foyer qui élève seule ses enfants;pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille,elle s'est lancée dans la commercialisation du credit de communication.par ailleurs,elle vend également des friandises ( bonbons,biscuits,etc....).soàn activité se déroule bien,mais elle sollicite néanmoins un credit chez nous qui va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de marchandises et de credit de communication.les benefices générés seront utilisés pour l'achat d'un contenaire afin de rendre plus confortable son point de vente et également pour ameliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Martine is a housewife who raises her children alone. To support herself and her children, she started selling phone credits. She also sells treats such as candy, cookies, etc. Despite her business being rather successful, she is seeking a loan to bolster her supply of merchandise to sell. 

The profits earned will be used to buy a container, which will make running her stall a lot easier. Her goal is to improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on phone credits and treats such as candy and cookies.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa, de 60 años de edad, esta casada con Juan quien es empleado y padre de sus 2 hijos.  Vive junto asu familia en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Eloisa  es la venta de abarrotes en general, por esta razón cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su hogar la cual lleva funcionando cerca a 7 años , tiempo que le sirvió para hacerse conocida entre sus vecinos y ganarse así una buena clientela.Le gusta su actividad ya que  puede estar  en casa  y atender a sus hijos, también le gusta el ingreso económico que le genera, con el cual puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Eloisa, tiene planeado incrementar el stock de sus productos para así tener más acogida entre sus clientes .Este es el préstamo número 3 con Kiva Y se siente contenta con la oportunidad brindada para incrementar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará  gran variedad de abarrotes como conservas, leches en polvo, aceites, arroz, entre otros , buscando así precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen .
texts.en:
Eloisa, 60, is married to Juan who is employed and the father of her two children. She lives with her family in their own home. Eloisa makes a living selling general store groceries. For this reason, she has a small store in her home which she has been working in for seven years, a period of time that served to make her known among her neighbors and gain a good clientele. 

She likes her work since she can be at home and attend to her children. She also likes the income that it generates, with which she can support her husband with home expenses. Eloisa is planning to increase the stock of her products in order to draw in more purchases from her clients.

This is her third loan from Kiva and she feels happy with the opportunity offered to her to increase her working capital. With the amount requested of 500 new Peruvian soles, she will buy a great variety of groceries such as preserves. powdered milk, oil, rice, and more, searching for the lowest prices for buying in large volume.

loans.use: to buy general store items

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 41 años y esta casado con Vilma de 41 años, juntos tienen 3 hijos Jenifer, Cristian y Evelyn a quienes  brindan el resultado de su esfuerzo.
Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble en la cual comparte sus vivencias familiares. Alberto se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico.
Inicialmente se desempeñaba como trabajador del lugar pero gracias a su firme trabajo logro ahorrar y junto a Vilma  adquirió una parcela para dedicarlo íntegramente al producto con mejor sustento económico de la región.
Así es como desde hace 10 años viene desempeñándose con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar quienes lo apoyan en las diversas tareas colectivas y forzosas. No obstante sus parcelas se encuentran algo distantes de la ciudad y esto dificulta el traslado de los granos de cacao que extrae.Actualmente se encuentra en medio de su campaña productiva puesto que es necesario no descuidar el constante mantenimiento que brinda a su parcela razón desea contar con capital de trabajo , motivo por el que acude a su entidad financiera.Alberto tiene como meta a largo plazo la compra de un vehiculo con el cual pueda transportar sus productos a menor costo.Requiere para esta ocasión contar con 500 nuevos soles y proceder con el pago a trabajadores que se encargan del deschuponado de sus plantaciones y culminar con el segundo deshierbo de campaña.
texts.en:
Alberto is 41 years old. He is married to Vilma, who is 41. Together they have three children, Jenifer, Cristian and Evelyn, whom they give the results of all their hard work. 

He has a house made out of brick where he lives with his family. Alberto grows organic cacao. He starting out as a worker but thanks to his hard work was able to save up and with Vilma acquired a land parcel to use for growing the most financially viable product in the area.   

That is why for 10 years he has been working with the help of some laborers who help him with the different tasks that are difficult and require a group efforts. Nonetheless, his land is somewhat far from the city and this makes it difficult to transport the cacao beans that he harvests. Right now, he is in the middle of a growing campaign because he can't neglect the constant maintenance of his land. That is why he wants to have working capital and he has turned to his financial institution. Alberto's long term goal is to buy a vehicle to transport his products at a lower cost. At this time, he needs to have 500 nuevos soles to pay for workers to prune the plants and finish the second weeding.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Maria de 47 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz, venta de cafe, flores y hortalizas vive con su esposo y sus  2 hijos de 11 y 16 años, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz.
texts.en: Maria, 47 years old, works by cultivating corn, and selling coffee, flowers, and vegetables. She lives with her husband and their 2 children who are 11 and 16 years old. She is a hard-working person and is very responsible when it comes to household obligations. She has always been known for providing her children with the best possible care. She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and tools for corn cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and tools

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es una mujer de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus 4 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Marleny no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Marleny trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida y raspadillas, ella vende deliciosos platos típicos de su ciudad y refrescantes raspadillas de distintos sabores a sus clientes, Marleny trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marleny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas, sillas y un toldo para implementar en su negocio, de esta manera Marleny brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Marleny is a 38 year old woman. She lives in the city of Nazca with her 4 children, whom she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all of her work into getting her family ahead, since she has to be both mother and father to her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and out of a need to work when she was very young, Marleny was unable to go to college. In her free time, she likes to watch television and sometimes cook a delicious Frejoles con Seco to share with her family. 

On her own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Marleny works at her own business selling food and snow cones. She sells delicious traditional food from her city and refreshing snow cones with different flavors to her customers. Marleny works every day for approximately 10 hours and she thinks it is going well for her because she is a good cook and because she is friendly to her customers. 

Marleny is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she can buy tables, chairs and a canopy for her business. This way,Marleny will offer a better service to her customers and she will continue to work and strive to make her dream come true of having a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a canopy.

loans.name: Partoton

texts.en:
Partoton, age 40, is a livestock farmer. He fattens goats and sheep for a living, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is a gentle person. He lives with his wife Norari and an extended family of five, whom he supports.

He learned about KADET Ltd from a group member. He is requesting his third loan in the amount of of KES 40,000, which will facilitate the purchase of animal feed. He plans to use the expected profits to pay for the education of his children. 

His primary dream is to raise the living standard of his large extended family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Richard Alberto

texts.es:
Richard es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Richard no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Richard se dedica al rubro de la construcción, él trabaja como maestro constructor, trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos acabados que les da sus obras.
Richard se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas de trabajo, como maderas, cubos y otros, de esta manera podrá desarrollar adecuadamente sus obras, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Richard is a 26 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Nazca. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. He is very ambitious. Unfortunately, however, due to a lack of economic resources, and as he had to work from a very young age, Richard was not able to pursue professional studies in Civil Engineering. 

In his free time he likes to listen to music and sometimes he cooks a delicious “Lomo Saltado”, a meat stir-fry, to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with a lot of determination and dedication, Richard works in the construction sector. He works as a master builder. He works every day for approximately 10 hours. He enjoys his work and thinks that it is going well for him as the finish he puts on his jobs is always very good.

Richard is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to their help he will be able to buy work tools and equipment, such as beams, buckets, etc. In this way, he can carry out his work well. This will enable him to continue working and persevering to achieve his dream, which his to have his own home and gradually get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es: Don Ramon de 36 años de edad se dedica a la venta y produccion de Maiz, pipian y maicillo, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 8 y 12 años, cliente tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo y venta de sus productos, solicita credito para la compra de insumos agricolas que le permitan sembrar y cultivar dichos productos y asi poderle dar a su familia lo que necesita y a sus hijos poder pagarles el estudio, el cliente es conocido como una persona responsable, trabajadora y muy honesta.
texts.en:
Ramon, 36 years old, grows and sells corn, pipian squash, and sorghum. He lives with his wife and two children who are 8 and 12 years old. 

He has a lot of experience in growing and selling his products. He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies so he can plant and grow the products and so be able to provide for his family and be able to pay educational fees for his children. 

He is known as a responsible, hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Vhibi

texts.en:
Vhibi, age 32, runs a grocery business in the town of Tala. She has been engaged in this business for five years and reports that it has been profitable. Vhibi and her husband have three children.
 
This will be her second loan term, and she plans to use the loan fundst to buy a stock of grocery items to offer for sale.This will include vegetables such as cabbages, spinach, potatoes, onions, and tomatoes, as well as fruits such as mangoes, oranges, and bananas.

She hopes to grow her business and eventually to open a larger grocery store, which will allow her to earn more income and be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to add a stock of vegetables and fruits to her grocery store

loans.name: Majimbo

texts.en:
Majimbo is requesting a Kiva loan of Kes 20,000 to boost her general store business. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital and stock up her general store in order to satisfy her customers’ requests. This will allow her to earn a better income. Specifically, she will buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, coffee bags, shampoo, and matches to offer for sale.

Majimbo is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they offer to small retailers with meager means so that they can be engaged in a dignified working activity.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, coffee bags, shampoo, and matches to offer for sale

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 51 years old and married with four children. He has a rental housing business in Tala town, has been in the business for the last eight years, and it has been profitable.

This is his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy building materials for constructing more rental houses.These materials include timber, iron sheets, doors and window frames, cement and paint. He anticipates making more income since the demand for houses in the area has increased.

He hopes to invest in the real estate business and make more money so as to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 56 years of age, married to a farmer and has three children. She is thankful because her business improved through the impact of her previous loan.

Ludivina aims to have a stable source of income and have a better way of living. To make all her dreams come true, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to allow her to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, eggs, instant noodles and cooking oil. She knows that through this loan, she can further improve her customer satisfaction and financial stability. So, she hopes and prays for approval of her requested loan amount to make her goals possible.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her retail store

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwanamvua is married and has two young children who study. She sells charcoal and has had the business for years. She started her business by necessity to earn profits. She sells at a street market. She wants the loan to invest in working capital and buy charcoal to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma’s business involves selling all types of seafood such as lobster. She needs the loan to buy bundles of fish and a cooler box for preservation. 

Fatuma is thankful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with limited resources so that they can have a dignified way to live.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell and a cooler box for fish preservation.

loans.name: Ata

texts.en:
Ata, now 51 years old, used her previous loan amount to purchase more stock of items for sell in her retail shop. She bought flour, sugar, cooking oil and kerosene. It was very profitable and she was able to pay all the loan amount.

This will be her third loan and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and washing detergents. She anticipates making more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop and hence, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her shop.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
This is Marciana. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed materials for her tailoring business. She was able to make more curtains, dresses, set covers and uniforms. She has been in this business for twenty years now. Aside from her dress shop, she also has a direct selling business and a burger stand. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. She will also use the loan in buying different merchandise products for her direct selling business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marciana dreams of continuous success of her business. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Luzmila

texts.es:
ROSA tiene 77 años de edad es viuda  no tiene hijos, tiene una casa vive con una sobrina en Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

ROSA se dedica a realizar juegos pirotecnicos. Solicita el crédito para comprar carrizo, hilo, cartón, polvora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesarío para realizar las luces pirotecnias.

 Las compras las realizará en Riobamba. El sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíso a los que se enfrentan es luchar ante cualquier problema que se le presenta.

En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con los familiares.
texts.en:
Rosa is 77 years old. She is a widow and she does not have children. She has a house where she lives with her niece in Chimbo, in the Province of Bolivar.

Rosa makes a living by making fireworks. She seeks this loan to buy reed, thread, cardboard and gunpowder. With the assistance of this loan she will be able to buy what she needs to make the fireworks. She will make her purchases in Riobamba. Her dream is to improve her quality of life. The challenges she has faced allow her to fight against any problem that presents itself to her. 

In her free time she likes to gather with her family.

loans.use: to buy reed, thread, cardboard and gunpowder.

loans.name: Suncica

texts.en:
Suncica is a hairdresser. She is living in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. Suncica is married and has three children. She started to work as a hairdresser 14 years ago. After a long time working, she needs to buy new tools.

Suncica now is in need of a loan to buy new hairdressing tools such as a new chair and other necessary tools. This will develop her business and increase the numbers of her clients. 

With the income Suncica generates from her business, she will improve the conditions for family life. She notes that this loan will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to develop her business more.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools, such as a new chair and other necessary tools.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Estrellas de belén de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y se dedica al decorado de artesanías, las que distribuye al interior del país, son chompas de colores y morrales hechos de  aguayo (aguayo es una tela hecha con hilos de diferentes colores).
El crédito lo requiere para  el aumento de su capital, pues adquirirá billeteras de cuero al por mayor, las que adornará con colores de aguayos.
El sueño de Daniel es tener una tienda donde venda todo tipo de artesanías.
Es la cuarta  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Daniel is single. He does not have any children and he lives with his parents in their home. His house can be found in the Villa Estrellas zone of Belén in the city of El Alto. He attended school through middle school and he works decorating crafts that he distributes in the interior of the country. His crafts are colorful sweaters and backpacks made of embroidered cloth called aguayo (aguayo is a fabric made with threads of many different colors). 

He needs the loan to increase his capital primarily so that he can acquire leather wallets that he will decorate with different colors of aguayo. Daniel's dream is to have a store where he can sell many different types of crafts.

This is the fourth time he has sought a loan through IMPRO and his third time through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy leather wallets so he can decorate them with embroidered colored cloth and sell them together with sweaters and backpacks made from embroidered cloth.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru: Гулбарчын 34 года,не замужемем. Гулбарчын в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 15 овец и 1 лошадь. Гульбарчын имеет 10,000 KGS имеет ежемесячного дохода.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулбарчын обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одну дойную корову. Доходы от кредита Гулбарчын планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulbarchyn is 34 years old and married.  Her business is the main source of income for her family.  She started her business working with livestock in 2000 with 8,000 KGS.  Today, she owns 4 cows, 15 sheep and 1 horse.  Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Gulbarchyn has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 35,000 KGS to buy a milk cow.  She plans to use the income provided by the loan to further increase the number of animals she has.

loans.use: To purchase 1 milk cow

loans.name: Sanambubu

texts.ru: Санамбубу 55 лет, вдова, дети Санамбубу взрослые и самостоятельные они активно помогают матери. Муж Санамбубу скоропостижно скончался. Санамбубу с 1992 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 5,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Санамбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова, 15 овец, 1 бычок и 2 теленка, ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,Санамбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Санамбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Sanambubu is 55 years old and a widow--her husband having passed away suddenly.  Her children are grown and actively help their mother.  Since 1992, Sanambubu has worked with livestock, having started her business with 5,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, today she owns 1 milk cow, 15 sheep, 1 bull and 2 calves.  This business brings in around 15,000 KGS monthly from the sale of milk and from reselling animals.  With the goal of further developing her business, Sanambubu has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle.  She plans to use the income provided by the loan to further expand her herd.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores tiene 45 años, trabajó desde muy joven, pues sus escasos recursos económicos no le permitían seguir preparándose con la educación secundaria. Nació en Pelileo en donde terminó su educación primaria, pero luego salió de esa ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades. Tiene 2 hijos, uno de los cuales ya es adulto y lleva una vida independiente, el otro vive con ella bajo su custodia y está estudiando. María Dolores, es soltera y ha dado a sus hijos la educación y el sustento, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo de todos los días. En la actualidad ella vive con su hijo menor en la Parroquia Chigüilpe a 15 minutos del centro de Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Esta parroquia tiene varias viviendas de cemento y mixtas de madera con cemento. Tiene un río que es muy visitado y en donde los turistas y habitantes practican varios deportes y además tienen la oportunidad de conocer una cultura tsáchila que suele contar sus leyendas a los visitantes en medio de una fogata y camping. Santo Domingo que es la tercera ciudad más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
María Dolores aprovechó su talento de poder preparar deliciosos platos típicos, para instalar un puesto de comidas fuera de su casa hace 14 años. Muchos de sus clientes la recomiendan en el sector, ya que el sazón de María Dolores es muy delicioso en todos sus platos “llapingachos”, “hornado”, “tripas asadas”, etc, que son platos muy apetecidos en todo el Ecuador. Esta mujer, ha tenido problemas con su cocina, pues ya tiene muchos años de trabajar todo el día desde tempranas horas en la mañana hasta después que se pone el sol, y le ha dado varios mantenimientos, pero sin embargo, ella cree que todo marcharía mejor con una cocina nueva. Cuando ha querido hacer esta compra, no ha podido encontrar financiamiento fácil, pues son muchas las trabas que le han puesto para concederle un crédito. En esta búsqueda encontró a Fundación Alternativa quienes con la ayuda de Kiva pudieron otorgarle un crédito el cual formará parte del crecimiento en su negocio y para que así, María Dolores mejore su calidad de vida y la de su hijo. Cuando le contamos a ella sobre la metodología Kiva se mostró muy agradecida y envió muchos saludos y bendiciones a las personas que alrededor del mundo están haciendo posibles los sueños de tantos microempresarios como ella.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 45 years old. She worked from an early age because financial need did not allow her to continue preparing for high school. She was born in Pelileo where she finished primary school, but later she left that city looking for better opportunities. She has two children, one of whom is an adult and has an independent life and the other lives under her care and is a student.

María Dolores is single and has given her children education and support, thanks to her daily work and efforts. Currently she lives with her younger son in the parish of Chigüilpe, some 15 minutes from the center of Santo Domingo, the capital city of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a place that has an active trade as it has become a land port of exchange between the mountain ranges and the coast of Ecuador.

This parish has several houses of cement and of wood mixed with cement. It has a much visited river where tourists and residents practice various sports and they have the opportunity of getting to know the culture of Tsáchila through legends related to visitors at campfires. Santo Domingo is the third most populous city of the region, and also contributes in the areas of agriculture, livestock, fishing and manufacturing.

María Dolores took advantage of her talent for preparing delicious typical food, and opened a food stand outside her home 14 years ago. Many of her customers recommend her in the neighborhood, as the flavors are delicious and all of her dishes, stuffed potato patties served with peanut sauce, slow roasted pork, and grilled beef tripes, etc., are greatly desired dishes all over Ecuador.

This woman has had problems with her stove. She has been working for many years every day from the early hours of morning until after the sun goes down, and she has maintained it, but all the same, she believes that everything would be better with a new stove.

When she wanted to go ahead with the work, she could not find easy financing, as there are many hoops to jump through in order to be granted credit. In this search she found Fundación Alternativa who with the help of Kiva could grant her a loan which will be part of the growth of her business and so María Dolores enriches her quality of life and that of her daughter. Upon hearing about Kiva’s methodology she expressed her thankfulness and sent many greetings and blessings to people around the world making dreams possible for so many micro-entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: to buy a new industrial gas stove for her business

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es casado y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos está en edad escolar, viven en casa de los suegros de Javier, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Javier estudió hasta el nivel secundario, y con  su esposa se dedican al armado de shorts deportivos, ellos reciben  cada semana ciertas cantidades de telas para su respectivo armado.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir una maquina cortadora para acelerar su trabajo.
El sueño de Javier es equipar su taller de costura con más maquinas y convertirse en un microempresario.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Javier is married and has two children. One of them is school-aged. They live in the house of Javier’s in-laws. The house is located in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto.

Javier studied until secondary school, and he and his wife put together gym shorts. Each week they receive a certain quantity of cloth for their respective assembly projects.

He needs the loan to acquire a cutting machine to speed up his work. 

Javier’s dream is to equip his sewing workshop with more machines and convert himself into a microentrepreneur.

This is the second time that he has applied for a loan through IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a cloth-cutting machine to speed up his work assembling gym shorts.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Гульмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается животноводством и садоводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день хозяйство Гульмиры очень развитое и и имеет хороший потенциал. На доходы от бизнеса Гульмира смогла купить дом для семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку саженцев элитных сортов яблок и удобрения. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira is 41 years old, married and is raising 3 children.  She is the main source of income for her family.  Since 1995, she has worked with livestock, having started her business with 10,000 KGS.  Today, her business is very fruitful and has a lot of potential.  With her income, she was able to buy a home for her family.  With the goal of further growth, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy high-quality apple tree seedlings.  The income the loan provides will be used to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase healthy young apple tree seedlings and fetilizers for them

loans.name: Year

texts.en:
Year, aged 77, is a widowed woman and lives together with her children from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She works in the agricultural business and also sells Khmer natural medicine to people around the province. She normally buys her medicines from a local supplier and retails in all of the surrounding areas for extra profit. Her time working in this type of business has given her good experience and she is able to generate approximately KHR 30,000 per day.

Year strives to work hard to cover her living costs and hopes to attain a better quality of life. She would like to increase a large volume of sale by adding more supplies of natural medicines to satisfy her clients. That is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of KHR 2,500,000 from Kiva lenders. She is confident she will repay her debt, and at the same time, she might give her family a good living status. She is very thankful to all kind lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies of natural medicines to satisfy her clients.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоилу 42 года. У него жена и двое детей. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Шахритус. Около своего дома Исмоил имеет магазин, где он и его семья занимаются продажей продуктов питания. Исмоил хочет заняться новым бизнесом и его интересует животноводство, так как в его местности имеются благоприятные условия для разведения скота. С этим намерением Исмоил запрашивает кредит для закупа и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. В дальнейшем он планирует расширить свой новый бизнес.
texts.en: Ismoil is 42 years old and has two children with his wife.  They live together in the Shahrituz region.  Ismoil has a store near his home where he and his family sell food goods.  He wants to start a new business and is interested in livestock since in his region is an excellent location for it.  With this intention, Ismoil is asking for a loan to start buying and reselling livestock.  In the future, he plans to expand his new business.

loans.use: To buy buy and resell livestock

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 45 years old, married, and supporting a family of three. She runs a retail shop and this has been her income generating business for the last ten years. She makes an average monthly profit of KES. 15,000. 

She has borrowed a loan of KES. 30,000, this being her second loan with KADET LTD. With this loan she intends to purchase more stock for her retail shop, i.e sugar, tea leaves, salt, cooking fat, and washing powder to sell.

She anticipates getting profits that she will use to pay school fees for her children. She will use the surplus to expand her business. Anne hopes to improve her living standard and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her retail shop, i.e sugar, tea leaves, salt, cooking fat, and washing powder

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 23 years old and from Migori County. He is married to Esther who is a housewife, and they are blessed with one child who is five years old.

He operates a motorbike transport business and has been doing this for the last five years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He is taking his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy another second hand motorbike; he will use the anticipated profit to reinvest into the business.

He has a dream of expanding his business and earning more income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase second hand motobike for his transportation business.

loans.name: Bojan

texts.en:
Bojan is 22 years old and single. He is from Kosovo and lives in a minority community. Bojan has been the owner of a food store for more than the last three years. He started with a small shop and now it has become a big shop. Bojan provides his products to Albanians and other nationalities that live in his community in Kosovo. He enjoys his business of selling food to people.

Bojan is seeking to gather enough money and to expand his business. He is requesting this loan in order to buy food products for his market. He hopes that the loan will help him to increase the size of his market and the amount of products he can supply. His goal is to expand his business in the future as a big market. Bojan is very happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy food products for his market

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул 51 год, замужем, имеет шестерых детей. Сразу после того как вышла замуж , в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Майрамкул ведет свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве, начав со стартовой суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство насчитывает 1 корову, 5 голов овец и 7 голов коз и 2,45 га земли где ежегодно сажает фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячно Майрамкул имеет доход в размере 11,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майрамкул обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В бизнес – планах Майрамкул - увеличение хозяйства и расширение своего бизнеса, а в семейных – накопить сбережения для оплаты обучения детей и планирует развить у себя на участке яблоневый сад.
texts.en: Mairamkul is 51 years old, married and has 6 children.  Immediately after marrying her husband and while searching for an income for her family, Mairamkul started her own livestock and farming business with 2,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, today she has 1 cow, 5 sheep, 10 goats, and 2.45 hectares of land where she plants beans and potatoes each year.  Her monthly income is now 11,000 KGS.  With the goal of growing her business further, Mairamkul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle.  Her future plans include expanding his business, planting an apple orchard, and saving for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for her farm

loans.name: Romnick

texts.en:
Romnick is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol and has been in the farming business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income.
Romnick is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina has been engaged in the food production and sales business for five years. Her spouse is an Overseas Filipino Worker. The couple were blessed with two children. Despite her situation as temporary single parent, she is still able to manage her business and family well. This time, she wants to increase the kilograms of frozen foods and fish she offers within her locality during the harvest season, but she struggles with a shortage of capital. With regards to this situation, she is requesting a loan of PHP40,000. She believes that this amount of loan will help her in fulfilling her dreams in life, most especially in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen foods such as longanisa (sausage), tocino (sweetened cured pork), and additional kilograms of fish for her food production sales business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 15,000 to boost her fish selling business. Now she needs the financing to invest in working capital and purchase a variety of good quality fish. Saumu is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources to have a means of living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish to sell.

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en: Musarat is 32 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Since 2007, Musarat has been running a beauty salon business. Her income is playing a vital role in her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of beauty products such as facial creams, beauty kits, hair treatment products, and cosmetic products. She is hopeful that the loan will be helpful for the growth of her business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase facial creams, beauty kits, hair treatment products, and cosmetic products for the salon.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a 53-year-old vegetable farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the vegetable farming business form more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.
Sergia is asking for a loan to buy more vegetable seedlings, fertilizers, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and her harvest, thus allowing her to sell more to the market.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seedlings, fertilizers, and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es soltero y no tiene hijos, viven en casa en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Alemania  de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como chofer para la misma dueña de la casa donde vive.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir el departamento en anticretico, así dejará de pagar los alquileres mensualmente (Anticrético es una figura legal por la cual entran en un acuerdo el dueño de casa y el inquilino para arrendar el departamento, habitación o casa por un periodo determinado y por un monto global acordado, el cual será devuelto al inquilino al término del contrato de alquiler).
El sueño de Edwin es tener su casa propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Edwin is single with no children, living in a rented house, located in the area of Villa Alemania in the city of El Alto. He studied up to secondary level and currently works as a driver for the owner of the house where he lives.

The loan he is requesting is to buy an apartment in Anticrético and thus stop paying monthly rent. (Anticrético is a legal concept for entering an agreement between the landlord and the tenant to lease the apartment, room or house for a determined period and agreed upon amount, which will be given back to the tenant at the end of the contract.) Edwin’s dream is to have his own home.

It is the first time that he is requesting a loan through Impro and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an Anticrético agreement in order to live more comfortably

loans.name: Jerono

texts.en:
Jerono is 33 years old, married, and she supports a family of two. She runs a retail shop and this has been her income generating business for the last year. She earns an average monthly income of Kshs 5,000.
 

She has borrowed a loan of KES. 10,000, this being her first loan with KADET LTD. With this loan she intends to purchase goods like maize flour, rice, baking powder, bar soaps, and tea leaves for her retail shop. She anticipates getting profits that she will use to pay school fees for her children

Jerono hopes to improve her living standard and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase goods like maize flour, rice, baking powder, bar soaps, and tea leaves for her retail shop.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es separada y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos está en etapa escolar estudia en un colegio público; viven en casa en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente elabora moldes para queques con la ayuda de su madre y sus hijos, sus productos los distribuye al por mayor.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir materia prima como ser: calamina, alambres y otros, para continuar con este negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos.
El sueño de Veronica es tener un taller más grande y así producir mayor cantidad de moldes.
Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Veronica is separated and has 2 children, one of whom is still of school age and studying in a public school. They live in a rented house, located in the Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto. Veronica studied up to secondary level and, at present, she is making cake molds, with the help of her mother and her children. They sell their products at wholesale.

The loan is needed to acquire primary materials such as corrugated iron, wire, and other items to continue with the business, which is her only source of income.

Veronica's dream is to have a larger shop and to produce a greater quantity of cake molds.

This is the 2nd time that Veronica has requested a joint loan from IMPRO and her 1st time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy at wholesale corrugated iron, wire, and other inputs to continue her cake mold-making business.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung, 42 years of age, is a married woman who is responsible for five children: two married children and three single children. She is currently residing in a village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She owns a few pieces of farmland where she grows rice for food. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Kung relies on the income from her husband who operates a recycling business in the surrounding areas of their neighborhood.

Kung would like to borrow a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorcycle for home use as well as to help support her husband in collecting recycled materials in far distant areas. Through the loan help, she believes that their profit will be increased as they continue to work very hard. In the future, Kung plans to expand her farmland and hopes to have a fruitful harvest in each season.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old.  She is married and has three children between 7 and 12.  They are in school, and they all live in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia.  She is a high school graduate. Since 2003, she  has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes and fabric.  She has many customers since she sells quality products. She started her business with loan from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends.  She spends eight hours on her business since the location of her shop is bit far from her house.   One of the problems she faces is vehicle traffic. Sometimes she is late to open her shop.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fabric and fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses) to expand her business, She plans to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses) to expand her business

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been working in a rice-farming business together with her husband for more than 3 years now. This is the source of their income. Her husband also works as a carpenter.

Zosima is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to pay her children's school fees. With this, she will be able to improve their farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm and to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida is a hard-working and business-oriented woman.  She has operated her home-based store for more than one year.  The profits from her home-based store go toward their daily consumption, needs of the children, and a monthly payment for the electric bill. Zoraida is 43 years old.  She is married and has six children. Three of her children are married, while three of them are still studying.

Zoraida would like to take out a loan of PHP8,000.  She will be using this amount to buy merchandise, such as eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and assorted biscuits for her home-based store.  She hopes that through this, she can keep her business progressive and profitable someday.  In this way, she can let her three children finish their studies and be able to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and assorted biscuits for her home-based store

loans.name: Attia

texts.en: Attia is 43 years old and married with four children between 6 to 26 years old. They are in school, and they all live in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia since it is the capital city of Liberia. She is a high school graduate. Since 2001 she has been involved in the selling of fashionable clothes (jeans, trousers, and dresses). She has many customers since she sells quality products. She started her business with some help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends eight hours on her business since the location of her shop is a bit far from her house. One of the problems she faces is vehicle traffic, and sometimes she arrives late to open her shop. She is requesting a loan to buy fashionable clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses) to expand her business. She plans to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fashionable clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses) to expand her business

loans.name: Juliet's' Group

texts.en:
Juliet's group is comprised of 13 hard-working women. Juliet is 16 years old and lives in Kiyinda, Uganda. For the past 2 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients to make food to sell and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and expand her restaurant into a bigger one. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Mery Natalia

texts.es:
MERY  tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en casa de unos familiares en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

MERY  se dedica a confeccionar y vender confites. Solicita el crédito para comprar maní, azúcar, canguil, panela, colorantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los materiales para poder confeccionar los productos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Chimbo.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. El sueño es incrementar el negocio- En elt iempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Mery is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the home of relatives in Chimbo in the province of Bolívar.

Mery works making and selling candy. She is asking for a loan in order to buy peanuts, sugar, popcorn, dark brown sugar, and food coloring. With the help of the loan she can buy supplies to help her make her products. She makes her purchases in the city of Chimbo.

The challenges that she faces is competition. Her dream is to expand the business. In her free time she likes to spend time with the family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar, popcorn, dark brown sugar, and food coloring for her candy business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 57 years old, derives his main income by transporting people in his small car to various destinations for a fee. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 ugx to complete his house, from which he hopes to generate some income once it is completed to supplement his income.

Joseph will use the money arising from the house to pay university tuition fees for his daughter and to repay the loan. He hopes to construct more units in the future to better meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is a 39-year-old married man and a father of two children from San Miguel, Bohol. He is engaged in motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income.
Benedicto is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle and spare parts like bearings, nuts and bolts, etc. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motorcycle and spare parts like bearings, nuts and bolts, etc.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is an excellent and efficient tailor. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a government employee while she is a mother of four children. 

Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business. She dreams to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Tushauriane Group

texts.en:
Catherin’s group has 12 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Catherin is pictured on the right of Tushauriane Group with her hand raised. Catherin is pictured amongst the 2 men and 10 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Catherin first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Catherin joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Catherin was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 8 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a goat and a cow and send her children to school. Catherin’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 6 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Upendo is a group of nine farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Rosemary. The group has nine members, all women. Rosemary is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Rosemary first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Rosemary joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Rosemary was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize per 3/4 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 18 bags per 3/4 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Rosemary’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 4.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy  es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa 25 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como chofer en la urbe alteña (ciudad de El Alto) pero de manera independiente. Así cubre sus gastos personales.
El crédito lo requiere para  el mantenimiento general de su movilidad que es su principal herrramienta de trabajo. 
El sueño de Freddy es tener otra movilidad y en un futuro abrir una empresa de radio taxis.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Freddy is single, has no children, and lives in his parents' house, located in the Villa 25 de Julio Zone of the City of El Alto.

Freddy studied up to the secondary level. At present, he works as a driver for the Urbe Altena [taxi company] in the City of El Alto, but as an independent. This is how he covers his personal expenses.

The loan he is requesting is for general maintenance on his vehicle, which is his principal work tool. 

Freddy's dream is to have another vehicle and, in the future, to open a radio taxi enterprise.

This is the 1st time he has solicited a loan jointly from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the costs of general maintenance for his vehicle for transporting passengers.

loans.name: Honorina

texts.es: La Sra. Honorina  tiene 34 años y 3 hijos todos se encuentran estudiando,   su actividad es la elaboración y venta de Caldo de Cardan, thimpu, sajta etc. En su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de la Mutualista,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución La Sra. Honorina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos al por mayor para su negocio como  (papa, chuño, arroz, etc.) para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos imprescindibles para la elaboración de sus comidas, La Sra. Honorina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia la cual dificulta en cierta manera las ventas, pero aun así tiene clientes y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos al por mayor, el deseo de La Sra. Honorina  es poder conseguir un anticrético de una tienda amplia ubicada en el primer piso, para que así tenga una tienda  más visible hacia los clientes.
texts.en: Honorina is 34 years old and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She makes and sells Cardan soup, thimpu, sajta, etc.  Her stall is located in the Mutalista zone.  This will be her first loan through the institution.   Honorina will use the money from this loan to buy supplies in quantity for her business (potatoes, chuño, rice, etc.) so she can make her delicious dishes.  She is asking for this loan because of a lack of cash with which to buy these ingredients.  Honorina has challenges in her business, such as competition that affects her sale, but she still has customers and will use these benefits to continue buying supplies in quantity.  Honorina’s hopes are to be able to rent a space on the first floor of a large store so that she can have a store that’s more visible to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and she has an electrical shop in Nairobi. She sells electrical appliances such as sockets, bulbs and electrical wires. She is married to James who is an electrician and they have two children who are 14 and 10 years old.

This will be her second loan and she plans to buy more stock of electrical appliances to sell. These include bulbs, sockets, circuit breakers, extensions as well as water heaters. She will use the generated income to buy more electrical appliances.

Rose hopes to expand her business by opening another electrical appliance shop and offer electrical installation services.

loans.use: To buy more stock of electrical appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo de 6 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que Guido es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Guido no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Guido trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Guido se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para mejorar los métodos de estudios de su pequeño hijo, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda, para así brindarle mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Guido is 33 years old.  He lives in the city of Ica, in the Parcona district, with his small 6 year old son, whom he loves and is his main reason for living.  Guido is a very friendly person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who dedicates all of his efforts to improving life for his son, as Guido is both mother and father to him.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial recourses and because he needed to start working at a very young age, Guido was not able to study for a professional career in Systems Engineering, but he would have liked to have been able to do so.  In his free time, he plays soccer with his friends, and occasionally prepares a delicious Arroz Chaufa (Peruvian fried rice) to share with his family.  

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Guido works as a mototaxi driver, providing transportation services in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and he thinks he is doing well because he knows which areas to find the greatest number of passengers.  Guido is very thankful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy a computer, which will help him provide better means for his small son to study.  He will also continue working and making efforts to achieve his biggest dream, which is to complete construction of his home in order to provide his family with better security and wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a second-time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) applying for Ugx 3,000,000. She paid the first loan well. She is a single mother in the business of selling household daily use items on a small scale.

She rents a single room house on the outskirts of the city with her two daughters who attend school. She pays for the education of her two daughters herself, since she has separated from her husband.

She applied for the loan with the intended purpose of purchasing a small piece of land to build a residential house. She is sure her life will soon change with the facility from UGAFODE as she will soon be able to move from the one single room that is both the living room as well as the bed room. With the loans, she is slowly taking steps toward making her dreams come true. 

Pictured is Robinah at the plot she has bought and on the ground are the bricks that she will use for constructing the house.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land and start construction.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old, married and supports a family of four. She runs a retail shop, and this has been her income-generating business for the last three years. She gets an average monthly income of 7,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

She has borrowed a loan of 30,000 KES as her first loan with KADET LTD. With this loan she intends to buy more stock of sugar and wheat flour for sale. 

She anticipates getting profits, which she will use to pay school fees for her grandchildren. Mary hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay college fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old, married and a father of children who are five and one years old. He owns a tea plantation and has been in operation for a period of 12 years. He earns an average of KES 25,000 from the sale of the tea leaves.

He is now applying for a second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD to purchase fresh tea leaves from the local farmers for trading. The profits he gets will be used to pay school fees for his children and repay the loan.

His dream is to have a bright future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for trading

loans.name: Aliskander

texts.en:
Aliskander is 64 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Aliskander is a teacher at the local elementary school and his grandson is studying at the school where he is teaching.
Twelve years ago, to earn extra income and improve the family’s living conditions, he started a sheep-breeding business. His son works with him. They sell 70 head of sheep during a month. From the income Aliskander is building a house for his son in his yard. His son's family needs their own space.
Aliskander has requested a loan to buy barley and feed for the animals. He wants to use the profits from the loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy barley and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 32 years old, married and a mother of two children aged nine and six. She sells new clothes in Kapsabet and has been in the business for a period of seven years, earning a monthly income of KES. 18,000.

She is now requesting her sixth loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase stock of new clothes for children, lady’s dresses, and men’s trousers and jackets. The anticipated profits she earns will be used to repay the loan and also restock more clothing.
Her dream is ensure her business prospers and also meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new clothes.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y su pequeña hija, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Juan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica, pero  le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación,  Juan trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño terreno, el cual en un futuro no muy lejano será su vivienda, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Juan is 31 years old.  He lives in Ica, in the Santiago district, with his wife and young daughter.  He loves them and they are his main reason for living.  He is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic.  He and his wife dedicate all of their efforts to improving the lives of their family.  Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources, Juan had to start working when he was very young and couldn't complete a degree in Mechanical Engineering, but he would have liked to do so very much.  In his free time, Juan plays soccer with his friends.  On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Juan works as a field laborer on an agricultural holding in the city.  He works approximately 10 hours every day and believes he has been successful due to his hard work and his friendly treatment of others.  Juan is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he will be able to purchase a small plot of land, which in the not-too-distant future will become his home.  He will continue working and making efforts to achieve his greatest dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Nubrah's Group

texts.en:
Nubrah's group is comprised of five hard working women. Nubrah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in Uganda. For the past year, Nubrah has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Nubrah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more T-shirts and trousers to sell and it will help Nubrah to generate greater profits and own another business in another center. Nubrah hopes that in the future, she will be able to pay fees for her young sister. 

Nubrah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more T-shirts and trousers to sell

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack is 25 years old, single and supports one of his siblings who is in school. He is a farmer and has been in operation now for a period of five years. His income is KES. 7,000 per month.

He is now requesting his second loan of KES. 10,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers for planting.
The profits he earns from the sale of his farm produce will be used to pay the loan and cultivate more land. His dream is to have a family and live happily.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maribel es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de medias, crianza de ganado, tienda de barrio, material de construcción, manualidades, producción de aretes y bordado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maribel es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medias; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace años al ver la necesidad de las personas de la comunidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de medias) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su propio domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO AMANECER” [New Dawn] communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Patacamaya center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Maribel is the treasurer. The communal bank members' businesses are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling socks, raising cattle, a neighborhood store, construction materials, hand made crafts, making earrings and embroidery.
