The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business people, including the member Maribel. She reports that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Right now, she has a business selling socks. She tells us that she started this business years ago when she saw the need among people in the community. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying socks that she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. Later, she will sell them from her own house. This work allows her to generate income to support her home as much as possible. She is in a common law marriage and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she saws she likes the lending.

loans.use: to buy socks.

loans.name: Misin

texts.en:
Misin is a married father of 5 children. His wife spends most of her time taking care of their children and home. Misin, for more than 25 years, has provided wood cutting services for heating homes in his community.
He is in need for a loan in order to repair his wood cutting machine. This loan will help him to improve his business dramatically because he has a higher level of demands and increase in the need for his services.  This will in turn raise the income for his family.
Through his work he helps his family and gives them everything they need. He is very happy to have the possibility of getting a loan so they have the chance to improve their living conditions and have healthy food.
He wants to thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to repair his wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with vegetables and fruit like oranges, tomatoes, peppers, papayas, pineapples and passion fruit to sell. Fatuma is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources so that they have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ramish

texts.en:
Ramish is 34 years old, married and has two children, a 4-year-old daughter and a 6-year-old son. His daughter goes to preschool and his son goes to school. He wants his daughter to become a teacher and his son to go into business. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Ramish has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region which is close to the occupied border.

This is Ramish's second loan from Kiva. He started his new business eight months ago to sell vegetables and fruits, but he still raises cattle to provide milk for his family. Now he needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy potatoes, apples and onions to sell at local bazaars, markets and deliver by car.

He wants to use the money from his new business to help his family. In the future he wants to have his own store in the bazaar and use his car to transport purchased vegetables and fruits. This will be more profitable for his business.  

He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, apples and onions to sell at local bazaars.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 20,000 to boost her business. She is requesting a loan to buy different clothing such as shoes, children's clothing, women's skirts, cosmetics etc. 

Hidaya is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders give low-income communities.

loans.use: to buy different clothing such as shoes, children's clothing, women's skirts, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es:
Heydi es una mujer de 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y su pequeño hijo de 5 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Heydi trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Heydi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada y desea poder construir parte de ella con materiales resistentes y adecuados, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada.
texts.en:
Heydi is 24 years old.  She lives in the city of Ica, in the Santiago district, with her parents and her young 5 year old son,whom she loves and is her main reason for living. She is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic, and she makes all efforts to improve the life of her son. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial recourses and because she needed to work starting at a very young age, Heydi was not able to study for a professional career in Agronomy.  In her free time she likes to prepare delicious desserts to share with her family.  

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Heydi, works as a field laborer on an agricultural holding in the city.  She works around 10 hours every day and thinks that she is successful due to her good work and friendly treatment of her customers.  Heydi is very thankful to the Kiva lenders as the help they provide will allow her to make improvements to her home, which is in a deteriorated state.  She wants to be able to construct part of it with better and more resistant materials.  She will continue working and making efforts to achieve her big dream of having a safe and suitable home.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 32-year-old man from Migori  He is married to Joyce, who also offers a little support for the family. He supports a family of four and they have been blessed with two children who are 12 and 14 years old, respectively.

George operates a motorbike and bicycle spare parts accessories store in Migori town. He has been doing this business for the last four years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is taking his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more spare parts to sell since his business is picking up well. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business and make it stable.

He has a dream of expanding his business to earn more income so he will be in a position to give his children the best education

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 43 years old. She lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with her 54-year-old husband and two sons (Erekle and Tsotne). Nearly everybody works in the family, but together they all only make a small monthly income. Khatuna is working privately as a babysitter, her husband has a car and is a taxi driver, and her younger son is working on a fuel station. 

Khatuna requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Khatuna has now requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the credit she has received, Khatuna will rent a space to open a food court where they make Turkish Donners, and will purchase a special mounting for it. She wants to employ her son Tsotne, and they will both set up the family business. Tukish Donner is very popular in Tbilisi and Khatuna will rent a place in the crowded area, where she hopes her business will be profitable. All of the family members will then be employed, and their income will significantly grow. The profit will give them opportunity to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To rent a space to open food court where they make Turkish Donners and purchase a special mounting for it

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 50,000 to boost her clothes selling business. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital, to stock her business by buying and selling merchandise, and to take advantage of the beginning of the school year to offer products such as shirts, t-shirts, camisoles, socks, stockings, underwear, skirts, shorts, and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Hovsep

texts.en:
Hovsep is 28 years old and lives in Vanadzor city with his parents, wife and son. 

For a long time, Hovsep worked as a delivery driver in one of Vanadzor's largest freight shipping companies. Now, Hovsep transports passengers with his own car in Vanadzor city and nearby cities. He has been engaged in this occupation for about three years. He has many clients in the lori area and can meet his young family's needs. 

However, Hovsep's big dream is to enlarge his activities and save more money for his son's future. For this dream he needs to work harder and requires a means of finance. Hovsep is requesting loan in order to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 18.  All of them go to school. Kiden runs a general store and has been in business for seven years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 45,000 SSP to purchase cooking, salt, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.
In five years, Kiden would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high competition in the market. Kiden says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

NB: .the next person sitting is a client but she was photographed by mistake and she has her own waiver.

loans.use: to buy more items like oil, salt, onions, etc

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past seven months, Betty has been working hard to manage her fish selling busines. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and buy more types of fish to sell, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to boost the business. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to improve her fish selling business and to buy more types of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
This is Rukia. Thanks to her desire to improve and get ahead, Rukia has had a business selling basic grains (rice and beans), sugar, ground nuts, cereals, soap and detergent for years in her community. Her work routine spans approximately 10 hours a day.

The objective of the loan is to increase her working capital and stock for her business by purchasing basic gains so that, in the not too distant future, she will be able to earn a better income. Rukia is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources so that they will have a way to obtain decent work.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more onions, salt and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Princess F.

texts.en:
Princess is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia. She is single, and she is a college student. She said she is very good at managing her business, and she enjoys how busy she can be with her business; it makes her proud of her business.

She has been selling fashion clothes in the local market. She started her business through the help of her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, dresses, jeans, trousers, etc.) for her business. She plans to expand her business and become an international businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, dresses, jeans, trousers, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, David no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones unos riquísimos Juanes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, David trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hermanos menores, ya que desea pagar la matrícula y comprar sus útiles escolares, de esta manera los pequeños podrán contar con los materiales necesarios para cursar sus estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio y poco a poco desea sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
David is a young man who is 19 years old.  He is single and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his parents and siblings.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because he needed to work to support his parents, David was not able to study for a degree in Medicine, but he would have liked to have done so.  In his free time he likes to watch television and sometimes make delicious "Juanes" (a typical Peruvian food) to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with great effort and dedication, David works as a field laborer on an agricultural holding in the city.  He works about 10 hours every day and he believes he is successful due to his good work and his friendly treatment of others.  David is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can pay for his younger siblings' school expenses.  He wants to pay for their registration fees and buy their school supplies.  In this way they young ones can have the materials they need to continue their studies.  He will therefore continue working and making efforts to achieve his greatest dream of having his own business and bit by bit improving the life of his family.

loans.use: to cover his siblings' school expenses.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es Casado, tiene 4 hijos: una mujer casada, y varón casado, el tercer hijo tiene 17 años que cursa el en ultimo año de colegio y el otro de 16 años que esta en 5to de secundaria. La familia vive en casa propia, ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Mario es transportista afiliado a uno de los  sindicatos de transportistas de La Paz, maneja un minibús, de lunes a sábado,  como jefe de su familia este ingreso le ayuda para poder solventar los gastos familiares como ser  alimentación, estudios, servicios básicos, y demás gastos en la familia; su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida y así ayuda financieramente al presupuesto familiar.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un motor para su movilidad.
El sueño de Mario, es contar con otro vehiculo que le de la oportunidades de mejorar sus ingresos.
En un cliente que requiere el apoyo de kiva porque tiene grandes aspiraciones de mejorar sus condiciones de vida para Él y su familia.
texts.en: Mario is married.  He has 4 children:  a married daughter, a married son, his third son is 17 and in the last year of high school, and his youngest, who is 16 years old and in the 5th year of secondary school. His family lives in a home they own in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.  Mario is a driver affiliated with one of the transportation unions of La Paz.  He drives a minibus from Monday to Saturday.  As the head of household, this income helps cover the family's expenses such as food, schooling, basic services, and other family expenses.  His wife sells meals and thus helps financially support the family as well. The loan Mario is requesting is to purchase a motor for his vehicle.  Mario's dream is to have a second vehicle which will provide him with opportunities to increase his income. He needs Kiva's support because he has great aspirations to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his minibus used to transport passengers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Grace has been working hard to manage her local pub, which brews local drinks.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business and buy more millet for making the local drink. This will help Grace generate greater profits and buy a goat. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a cow.

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more millet for making the local drink

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en:
Sharafat is 53 years old and has three sons. He is a very passionate and energetic person in everyday life. Sharafat is always inspired by his sons and has big dreams for his sons - that they will be educated and become good members of society. 

Sharafat grows vegetables and fruits. He takes them to the central bazaar to sell for profits. Sharafat and his wife have been doing this for fifteen years. He loves his job, because he considers agricultural activity to be a contribution to society. In Azerbaijan, fruit is served as dessert and vegetables are used in daily meals.

He has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest once and has a good loan history. This time he has applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. Sharafat wants to grow more vegetables and fruit when the climate gets warmer after winter, and there is upcoming demand for these products in summer.

loans.use: to grow more vegetables and fruit to sell in the central bazaar.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, aged 55, is from Msambweni. She is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. 

Fatuma is a very hardworking, responsible person. Her economic activity for the last six years has been selling seafood. The business consists of buying and selling seafood, and she does this both from place to place, and in a local market. 

She needs financing to invest in working capital to stock her business. Fatuma is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources to better their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is 42 years old, and is a widow with seven children, all of whom are dependent on her support. 

Mbodze is a hard-working, responsible woman with a desire to succeed. She has been running a corner store business from her house for the last two years. In her corner store, she sells daily consumed products in small quantities, such as coffee, rice, beans, sugar, firewood, milk, eggs, detergents, soap and wheat flour. The business came out of needing a source of income to help with the household expenses. 

The object of the loan is to invest it in business capital and to stock her store in order to generate more income. Mbodze is grateful for the help Kiva investors offer those with few resources, so that they can have a dignified work environment.

loans.use: stock her store with products, such as coffee, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, firewood, milk, eggs, detergents, soap and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alsad

texts.en:
Alsad is 45 years old and has three children. He is very hard-working person, because it requires continuous effort to take care of a family of five people. Alsad is working in a service sector business. He has a lot of experience of dealing with many customers.

Alsad has been managing a small restaurant in the central market. In this restaurant, he serves several dishes, such as kebabs, soups and other traditional foods. He has been working in this sector for ten years. He says the service sector is a very delicate area, because people always pay attention to how they are being served.

This is Alsad’s second time applying for loan in Aqroinvest. He is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN. With this loan he plans to buy more dishes, chairs and a few tables. He is really optimistic about this loans positive effects, because he believes that more customers are enjoying dining out recently.

loans.use: to buy more furniture to expand his restaurant and to increase his customer base.

loans.name: Goncha

texts.en:
Goncha is 36 years old. She lives in Gardabani District with her retired mother in-law and two sons (Elnur and Gasan). The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Goncha’s mother-in law-and her small salary from the shop where she is working as a seller.

Goncha has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Goncha has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Goncha will purchase calves for a good price. Her sons will help her, and they will raise the calves for a while to sell them at the local markets with a price markup. Goncha hopes her new business will be profitable so she can reinvest the profits and develop her farming. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves for a good price, raise them and then sell the calves at local markets for with a price markup.

loans.name: Lokolong

texts.en:
Lokolong is a 36-year-old businessman who live in Yei. He is married with three children between the ages 3 and 9. All of them go to school.

Lokolong runs a general store, and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. Outside of this business, he has no other source of income.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more sugar, flour, and many other items to sell in his general store. 

In five years, Lokolong would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost. Lokolong says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, beans and other items to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca tiene 27 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 3 meses, ella junto a su esposo tienen un  taller de conversión de vehículos de gasolina  a gas, ya que muchos choferes realizan esta conversión para reducir sus gastos ya que el gas es más económico que la gasolina,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Blanca va a usar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas necesarias para realizar el trabajo de conversión de vehículos de gasolina  a gas y así de esta manera incrementar su  capital de trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de ampliar su taller  y satisfacer a sus clientes la Sra. Blanca enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que cuentas su esposo y ella, por este motivo se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Ms. Blanca is 27 years old, married, and has a 3-month old son. Together with her husband, she has a business converting vehicles from the use of gasoline to the use of natural gas. Many drivers are getting this conversion to reduce their expenses, because natural gas is less expensive than gasoline. This loan is Blanca's first within this lending institution. Her reason for applying for this loan is the need to improve her workshop and better satisfy her clients. She will use the loan money to buy supplies and tools needed for converting vehicles from using gasoline to using natural gas. Through this, she will build capital. Blanca is facing challenges with her business, such as increasing her clientele and being able to use her profits to improve her family's quality of life. The workshop is the only income-generating activity that she and her spouse have. Because of this, she feels happy and grateful with the institution for the support they have shown her, allowing her to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for her vehicle conversion business.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is married and has children to care for who attend school. He lives in Msambweni and has a business buying and selling basic grains such as beans, rice, corn and other things which he buys in Mombasa town.

He has always been concerned with providing good service to his customers who include merchants in the market, grocery stores and other steady customers. He will use the money to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, wheat and other things. In this way he can provide a better assortment for his customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, wheat and other things

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 8 years, selling to all categories of people but on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.

She works at the market six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to start going to villages in Masaka for green bananas. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items likes beans, dagga fish, etc.

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en:
Fetije is a 38-year-old Ashkali woman living in an Ashkali community in Kosovo. She is a married, a housewife, and has six children. Her husband is a musician who performs at weddings and other celebrations. The family's main source of income comes from her husband. They live in unacceptable conditions. They live in a small village, and during the rainy season and winter time, they have a serious problem with their windows and doors.

Fetije needs a loan to renovate her house and improve the living conditions of her family. She hopes in the future to give her children a better education. Fetije is grateful to Kiva lenders for improving her family's condition and standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Eron

texts.en: Eron is married with two children. Only one of her children goes to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for 5 years. She sells to all categories of people. She does not have any other income-generating activity. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal. She works six days of every week and sells the charcoal from her home on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include the transportation of the bags of charcoal and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is characterized as a responsible and hard working woman who has a great desire to improve herself personally. She has a convenience store - a kiosk - located in her house, which she has had for three years since she started making a living with this business. A kiosk is a small store that sells daily consumption products in small quantities including coffee packets, rice, sugar, oil, soap, eggs, salt, beans and bread.

She began the business with the goal to have a job so that she could take care of herself and meet her household expenses. The loan's purpose is to invest in working capital and stock the business in order to satisfy her customers. Mwanajuma has worked with Yehu Microfinance and has demonstrated her responsibility in paying on time and in full.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of coffee packets, rice, sugar, oil, soap, eggs, salt, beans and bread.

loans.name: Dinah's Group

texts.en:
Dinah's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Dinah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Dinah has been working hard to manage her small hotel/catering business, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Dinah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other kinds of food for the restaurant and will help Dinah to generate greater profits and expand the business. Dinah hopes that in the future she will be able to increase on the capital.

Dinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of food for the restaurant

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is described as a responsible, hardworking woman. The objective of this loan is to make improvements to her home, like repairing her kitchen. With the loan, she'll buy construction materials such as zinc, cement, bricks, wire and iron.

Mwanajuma is grateful for the help Kiva investors give to people of few resources so that they can have a decent roof to live under.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc, cement, bricks, wire and iron

loans.name: Raci

texts.en:
Raci is 36 years and has 3 children. Raci is a very young and ambitious person. He runs a store. He has been selling various products in his store for the past five years. He sells different washing soaps and liquids, hair brushes, toothpaste, and also food products such as tea, sugar cubes, cheese, bread and butter. Raci’s brother supports him in the business.

Raci’s store is in the central market. Because of its good location he has regular customers. His monthly income from the business is 170 AZN. With his future plans for the store he hopes to be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

Raci is going to take a loan of 1,500 AZN from Aqroinvest for the second time. His good loan history has given him the confidence to go for a second loan. He plans to bring more products into the store in order to meet the demand of the upcoming spring holiday Novruz.

loans.use: to buy more products for the store for the upcoming spring holiday

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is married; he is 37 years old and from Tulkarem. Adel has owned a poultry farm since 2011,  and has one employee.

He has asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy forage (plant material eaten by farm animals) and poultry.

Adel hopes this loan will help him enlarge his poultry farm space and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy forage and poultry for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Ayo Ayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AYO AYO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de celulares, venta de comida, venta de hortalizas, venta de tarjetas telefónicas, compra y venta de ganado, transportista.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betty es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace tres años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito.
texts.en: The communal association "AYO AYO" is beginning its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. The group is composed of 8 members and is directed by a board, of which Ms. Betty is the President. The members' businesses are varied and include: cell phone sales, food sales, vegetable sales, phone card sales, buying and selling livestock, and transportation. The loan will have important benefits for the group of small business owners of which Betty is a member. She says that she has already had two loan cycles with Pro Mujer, becoming involved at the invitation of a recruiter from the institution who visited her at home. Betty has a business selling food. She has had the business for three years, beginning it on her own initiative. The loan for which she is applying now will be used to augment her capital, buying supplies such as rice, oil, and noodles from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, which she will use to make items for sale at her business. This type of work allows Betty to earn income to maintain her home, because she is married and has a child. When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training in credit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Mundia

texts.en:
When Mundia got his first Kiva loan, he was able to grow his business and use the profit that he earned to open three new shops. His shops are located in the Western province of Zambia. They are in the remote districts of Shango'mbo, Itezhi-tezi and TBZ.
 
He says that his family benefited greatly from his business growth because he has been able to provide employment to his sons. He is proud of the fact that opening his businesses in these remote areas have added value to the local communities because they no longer have to travel long distances for money transfers.

Mundia fully repaid his first loan and is requesting a second loan so that he can increase his working capital for his newly opened shops. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase his working capital to process more money transfers.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 39 years old, married and has four children. For the past six years she has made a living selling seafood (fish, shellfish, octopus and other items depending on demand). She stands out as an enterprising person with a desire to move up in life, as her business has grown so much that she sells to restaurants and in other parts of the country. 

Mwanakombo is requesting the loan because she wants to expand her market even more, purchasing more fish in bundles for distribution.  This will help her make headway for all of her children, who look to her as an example of self-improvement.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y  venta de pan conversando con el nos conto  que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos ya que ahora incremento su producción, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, manteca y demás insumos para la elaboración de pan ya que en este último tiempo incremento su clientela.
texts.en: Luis is continuing with his business making and selling bread.  Conversing with us, he said that things went very well with his last loan, because he was able to buy supplies and increase his production.  At this time, he is requesting a loan to buy flour, butter, and other supplies to make bread, because his customer base has been expanding.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale such as flour and butter

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is 22 years old, from Gaza.  He has owned a shop for selling tv satellites since 2010.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy programming machines and more goods for the shop.

Anas hopes that this loan will help him buy more goods and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy programming machines and more goods for his shop.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en: Hamadi is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost his retail shop business. He is requesting a loan to use as working capital to stock his store with daily consumption groceries such as rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, chicken and matches. Hamadi is grateful for the help being given to people with scarce resources so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy consumption groceries such as rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, chicken and matches.

loans.name: Mwajine

texts.en:
With enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead, Mwajine runs a store where she sells basic household products and foods such as coffee, oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and beans at retail. She sells merchandise to her neighbors ten hours a day.

The purpose of this loan is to provide capital to stock her store so that she can increase her income. Mwajine thanks the Kiva lenders for their support for low-income people because it provides them with the means for decent work.

loans.use: to buy items such as coffee, oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and  beans to stock her store.

loans.name: Lourdes Rocio

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil unión libres tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas  Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Lourdes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales cómo gallinas, cerdos, patos y pavos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas, morocho, polvillo.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las hacen en Ventanas. El sueño es poder salir adelante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es no tener terrenos propios. En el tiempo libre le gusta ayudar a los hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 40, is in a common-law marriage and has 6 children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province.  

The communal bank "Bendición de Dios" meets in Recinto Rancho Grande in the Puerto Pechiche parish.  The members work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Lourdes is a farmer who cultivates corn and rice.  She also raises animals such as hens, pigs, ducks, and turkeys.  She is requesting a loan to buy urea, insecticides, liquid pesticides, and animal feed made from rice and corn.  

With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the agricultural supplies that she needs.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to be able to get ahead, thanks to the loan that she's being granted by the Cooperative.  Her main challenge is that she doesn't have her own land.  

In her free time, Lourdes enjoys helping her children with their schoolwork.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid pesticides, and animal feed made from rice and corn

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells Accra kenkey (a traditional corn-based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Efua has received some formal education through the equivalent of junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Efua has been selling Accra kenkey for three years. 

She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase more corn to prepare her kenkey recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her kenkey enterprise and meet the needs of more customers who want her tasty kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to prepare her kenkey (traditional corn-based dish) recipe.

loans.name: Concilia

texts.en: Concilia is 58 years old. She sells bananas and has been in the business for seven years. She is married with six children, and all her children go to school. She has requested the loan to add more bananas for sale. The profits from her business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Crisostomo

texts.es:
Crisostomo, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Bella vista de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día como albañil ya que con sus pocos ingresos debe cubrir el pago de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material (ladrillo, cemento, arena, estuco) para la construcción de una pared en su vivienda y para realizar el acabado fino ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Crisostomo es terminar la construcción de su vivienda para poder acoger a sus hijos y darles más comodidad y seguridad.
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Crisostomo is married and has 4 children who are now independent.  He lives in his own house, occupying two rooms with brick walls and an earthen floor.  The house is located in the Bella Vista neighborhood of La Paz.

Crisostomo now works more than 8 hours a day as a bricklayer, because with his modest income he must cover the expenses for food and basic utilities.

Crisostomo needs a loan to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, sand, and stucco) to build a wall in his house, and to do some finishing touches on the house, because he wants to improve his quality of life.

His dream is to finish the construction on his house so that he can accommodate his children and provide them with more comfort and security.  This is the 5th time that he has requested financing from IMPRO, and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and stucco to build a wall and to make some finishing touches on his house

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es: Don Tomas tiene 47 años de edad es originario de una comunidad indígena mazahua, población que colinda con los límites del Estado de Michoacán con el Estado de México, no es de muy fácil acceso la llegada a la comunidad ya que casi no hay transporte para esa población y uno tiene que caminar para agarrar el micro que pasa. Don Tomas es parte de un grupo llamado Las Palomas dice que es la primera vez que entra a un grupo de personas para pedir un crédito y que lo está solicitando porque tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad la cual quiere surtir con el crédito que le hagan, dice que cada semana se va a la población de Zitacuaro a comprar los artículos que vende y que también compra verdura para que la gente de su comunidad no gaste pasajes el procura por tener bien surtido su changarro y dice que si le dan el crédito comprara jitomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, huevo, frijol, habas, arroz, chocolate, azúcar, sal, cerillos, focos, aceite para cocinar, sopas, refrescos, plátanos, papel higiénico, atún, sardinas, chiles en vinagre, y más productos de primera necesidad. Dice que el crédito le servirá para mejorar su tienda ya que es la única que esta bien surtida, su sueño de don Tomas es hacerla un poco mas amplia para que los productos quepan mejor y que fuera de material ya que es de tablas de madera. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Virginia, Susana, Angelina, Maria Regina, Fernanda, Carmen, Celia, Bulmaro, Esperanza y Marcia ellos invertirán en un caballo para rentarlo en las parcelas, para la compra de borregos y alimento para este, para la compra de una vaca lechera, para la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros, para dulces para su venta, para la compra de artículos para abarrotes.
texts.en: Don Tomas is 47 years old and is originally from a Mazahua indigenous community. The community is adjacent to the boundaries of Michoacán State in Mexico. It is not very easy to access the community, because there is almost no transportation to the town and one has to walk to catch the microbus that passes by. Don Tomas is part of a group called Las Palomas ('The Doves'). He says it is the first time he has joined a lending group. He is asking for this loan because he has a small grocery and supply store in his community, and would like to stock the store using this money. Every week he goes to the town of Zitacuaro to buy vegetables and other items to sell so his store is well-stocked and customers in his community do not have to waste their time traveling to get what they need. Don Tomas says he will use the loan money to buy tomatoes, chile peppers, onions, potatoes, eggs, beans, rice, chocolate, sugar, salt, matches, light bulbs, cooking oil, soups, soft drinks, plantains, toilet paper, tuna, sardines, chiles in vinegar, and other necessities. The credit will help him improve his business, which is the only well-stocked store in the community. His dream is to make his shop a little bigger so that the products fit better. The other members of his lending group are called Virginia, Susana, Angelina, Maria Regina, Fernanda, Carmen, Celia, Bulmaro, Esperanza, and Marcia. They will invest their portions of the loan money in items for their businesses, such as buying a horse for working plots of land, purchasing sheep and food for the sheep, buying a cow for milking, and buying men's and women's clothing, sweets, and other items for sale.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and other items for a small grocery/general store, such as: tomatoes, chile peppers, onions, potatoes, eggs, beans, rice, chocolate, sugar, salt, matches, light bulbs, cooking oil, soups, soft drinks, plantains, toilet paper, tuna, sardines, chiles in vinegar, and other necessities.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude  is married, with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two orphans. She has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for five years. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000/= (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread. She also generates additional income through teaching and bridal ware. She sells on wholesale only and works six days out of every week. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to build her own business premises and also to own a bridal ware shop. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread for her sewing business.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca  is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Jesca  has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells breakfast and lunch. 

To help expand her business, Jesca has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy material to put in the restaurant, and will help Jesca to generate greater profits and lead to increased returns and expansion of the restaurant. Jesca hopes that in the future, she will be able to add more money to the business. 

Jesca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy material to put in her restaurant.

loans.name: Aves De Paraíso Group

texts.es: Doña Socorro tiene 51 años de edad, ella tuvo varios hijos pero nada más uno vive con ella el cual estudia la universidad en Morelia, ella desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de material para construcción en su casa ya que tiene un terreno amplio y vende cemento, tejas, tabique, tabicón, varillas, herramientas para la construcción, palas, picos, cucharas, arena, graba, cal etc. Dice que la mayoría de los materiales los compra en la ciudad de Toluca donde le llevan el material hasta  su negocio. Ahorita ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material como tabique  que es lo que mas vende y ese lo surte en unas localidades que se dedican hacer ese material para la construcción ya que se lo venden por millar y ella va por el tabique hasta la población de la Colonia Nueva de San Felipe ya que le dan precios bajos. Dice que está muy contenta y satisfecha por el negocio grande que tiene ya que es lo único que les puede dejar de herencia a sus hijos y que también está contenta porque está en un grupo llamado Aves del Paraíso ya que todas las personas que lo integran son responsables y su ayudan unos con otros. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Isela, María Remedios, Cirenia, Yaquelin, Marcela, Sandra, Florencio y Maribel ellos invertirán en sus negocios de Dulcerías, en la compra de insumos para elaborar tortillas a mano y venderlas, en la compra de artículos para invertir en tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de madera y material para hacer cajas de madera para frutas, en la compra de alimentos para animales para su venta y en la compra de paletas de hielo para su venta.
texts.en:
Doña Socorro is 51 years old.  She has several children but only one of them lives with her and he studies at the university in Morelia.  For 20 years she has worked selling construction materials in her home as she has a spacious piece of land.  She sells cement, tiles, bricks, cinder blocks, rods, construction tools, shovels, pickaxes, trowels, sand, gravel, lime, etc.  She says that she purchases most of the materials in the city of Toluca where they bring the materials to her business.  Right now she is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials like bricks which are what she sells most and which are supplied in some towns that are dedicated to making this construction material.  They sell it to her by the thousand.  She goes for the bricks as far as the town of Colonia Nueva de San Felipe since they give her low prices.  

She says that she is very happy and satisfied with the large business that she has since it is the only one that can leave an inheritance for her children.  She is also happy because she is in a group called “Birds of Paradise” since all of the people that comprise it are responsible and help one another.  The other members of the group are Isela, María Remedios, Cirenia, Yaquelin, Marcela, Sandra, Florencio and Maribel.  They will invest in their businesses of a candy store, in the purchase of supplies to make tortillas by hand and sell them, in the purchase of items to invest in a grocery store, in the purchase of wood and material to make wooden boxes for fruit, in the purchase of feed for animals for sale and in the purchase of popsicles for sale.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bricks.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita es una mujer de 54 años, es casada y tiene una de las mejores profesiones que ayudan a la sociedad; ser maestra. A ella le importa mucho la educación de sus alumnos y siempre usa métodos de enseñanza para que ellos puedan entender y ver el mundo de una mejor manera. Además de ser maestra la Sra. Margarita es comerciante y junto con la ayuda de su esposo venden ropa de temporada y es la manera  en que ellos pueden obtener un ingreso más. La Sra. Margarita está solicitando nuestra ayuda por medio de kiva para la compra de mercancía ya que necesita ropa de temporada y sus clientes se lo están solicitando. Ella siempre busca emprender algo nuevo, enseñarles a las personas a su alrededor  y sobre todo a sus alumnos que trabajando honradamente se puede vivir bien y satisfactoriamente.
texts.en: Ms. Margarita is 54 years old, married, and has one of the best professions for helping society: she is a teacher. The education of her students is very important to her, and she always uses teaching methods that make the students able to understand and see the world in a better way. In addition to being a teacher, Ms. Margarita is a businesswoman. She and her husband sell used clothes so that they have another source of income. Ms. Margarita is asking for our help through Kiva to purchase merchandise and clothing items that customers are requesting. She always is looking to take on something new and to teach people around her (and most importantly, her students) that by honest work, one can live well.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her business selling groundnuts (peanuts). 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business and buy more sacks of groundnuts to sell. This will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to look after her family. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana tiene 58 años,  Se dedica a la venta de artículos de “Tienda de Barrio”, en los que vende Azúcar, Arroz, Leche refrescos y Licores que se encuentran en la zona Pabon  de la ciudad de La Paz. Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana va a usar este préstamo en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, Además de la refacción de su domicilio ya que la época de lluvias a afectado su infraestructura, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que la  cliente necesita el dinero para invertir en su negocio, se animo a solicitar un crédito KIVA debido a los beneficios que le proporciona,  La Sra. Ana enfrenta retos en su negocio que no tiene un buen lugar ya que está un poco oculto de la avenida pero le va muy bien ya que tiene clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios Comprar  mercadería como: Arroz, Azúcar, Fideos, Sopas instantáneas, Refrescos, Jugos y otros a precio mayoritario para ahorrar en la compra y maximizar sus ganancias, su deseo es que  desea mejorar su domicilio,  construir su domicilio y hacerlo más habitable.
texts.en: Ms. Ana is 58 years old. She runs a neighborhood store, where she sells sugar, rice, milk, soft drinks, and liquor that she purchases in the in the Pabon zone in the city of La Paz. This loan is her second cycle with this lending institution. Ms. Ana will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise for her store, as well for the renovation of her home, because the large amount of rain has affected its infrastructure. Her reason for asking for the loan is because she needs money to invest in her business. She was motivated to apply for a Kiva loan because of the benefits it provides. Ms. Ana faces some challenges with her business, such as that her store does not have a good location as it is a little hidden from the main street, but it is doing well nonetheless because she has a good clientele. She will use the loan benefits to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, noodles, instant soups, soft drinks, juices, and other items at wholesale to save money and maximize her profits. Her dream is to improve her home, remodeling it and making it more habitable.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store, and to renovate her home because the rainy season has affected its infrastructure.

loans.name: Nassir

texts.en:
Nassir is married and has children who all attend school. Nassir works at a grocery store, which is in his home. He has had this business for years.

At the grocery store, he sells retail products such as coffee, tomato sauce, rice, beans, soap, sugar, milk and bread. All of these come in small quantities. He started the business as a way to have income for his family, since he does not have an education due to a lack of resources and money.

loans.use: to stock his store with daily consumer products such as coffee,  tomato sauce, rice, beans, soap, sugar, milk and bread.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Pamoja Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of 14 women and two men led by Ezina, pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Ezina joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Ezina joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Ezina reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about five bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 18 bags per acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. Ezina’s group members will each receive input loans of half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 8 acres of maize and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is aged 50. She is married with five children between the ages of 20 and 34; they all have married. She sells charcoal and has spent one year in this business. With the loan, she wants to add more sacks of charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 50 años de edad estado civil casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa  y con sus hijos en la ciudad de Ventas Provincia de los Ríos. 

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultora a la siembra de maíz, arroz, a demás se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos, pato. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas, morocho, polvillo vacunas para los pollos ranger.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras los realizan en Ventanas. El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan es no tener terrenos propios. En el tiempo libre se dedica a descansar.
texts.en:
Cesar is 50 years old and is married with 4 children. He lives with his spouse and children in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank Bendición de Dios is located in the rural community of Rancho Grande of the Puerto Pechiche parish. They work in agriculture and livestock.

Cesar works in agriculture, growing corn and rice, and he also raises animals like hens, pigs and ducks. He is asking for this loan to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed, and vaccines for the chickens.

With the help of this loan he will be able to buy necessary inputs for agriculture. He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to get ahead in life thanks to the loans provided by the cooperative. The challenge he faces is not having his own land. He spends his free time relaxing.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed and vaccines for chickens.

loans.name: Sheqer

texts.en:
Sheqer is 53 years old and married. He is the father of four. Sheqer lives in the southern part of Kosovo in a minority community. To earn a living, he works as a woodcutter in his area. The family's current main source of income comes from him. His wife is a housewife taking care of the children. Their house has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep the house warm.

Sheqer’s family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter. Sheqer requested a loan in order to do general renovation of the house. He needs to change the roof and to renovate the toilet. The loan will help him to improve conditions for his family. He is hoping to give a better life and education to his children in the future. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To change his roof and renovate the toilet

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi, who is married to a mason and the mother of five children, has been selling kenkey (a traditional corn-based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma, near Cape Coast, for 21 years. Maame Esi, who received no formal education, helps her husband in paying their general bills whilst also supporting their adult children whenever they can.

Her loan will be used to buy more corn, thus helping her prepare more of her kenkey recipe. Maame Esi hopes to use the new profits arising from her business to increase her working capital and expand her kenkey enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more corn, thus helping her prepare more of her kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Mwajine

texts.en:
Mwajine is from Msambweni; she is a very hard-working person who has always worked and strived to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a grocery store in downtown Msambweni; she has had it for more than seven years and comments that it has attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that she has a good clientele. 

She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Mwajine is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she is getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products

loans.name: Micheline

texts.en: Micheline is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. With the loan, she wants to buy more items to sell in her store such as rice and sugar. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari is 28 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has one child.

He has owned a grocery store since July 2012, and has one employee. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to install new shelves and buy goods.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and improve his income.

loans.use: to install new shelves and buy goods.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca primarily makes her living selling food items — fruit salads, drinks and basic items. Her neighbors admire her because they consider her to be very self-sacrificing, above all else. Thanks to her efforts, in conjunction with her husband's, they are able to raise their children and give them the education they needed. Thanks to this great effort, their three children all attend school.

Rebecca needs the loan to purchase drinks, dairy products and other items with which she will be able to stock up and have the variety that her customers ask for.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is age 51. She is a widow and has seven children she takes care of. Two of them attend schools. She owns a boutique which she has been running for the past eight years. She wants this loan to add more items such as salt and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as salt and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 34 years old. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Zoila Idalia

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 49 años de d edad estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas  Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Zoila se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol a de mas se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos. Solicita el credito para comprar de urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas, morocho, polvillo vacunas para los cerdos  ranger.

 Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compran los realizan  en Ventanas. El sueño es seguir  a delante gracias al crédito que la  cooperativa  otorgaa los agricultores para seguir progresando. Los desafíos es la falta de la capital de trabajo. Su tiempo libre se dedica a descansar
texts.en:
Zoila is 49 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has 5 children and lives with them and her spouse in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

The communal bank Bendición de Dios is located in the rural community of Rancho Grande of the Puerto Pechiche parish. They work in agriculture and livestock.

Zoila works in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and also works raising animals such as hens, ducks and pigs. She is asking for this loan to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed and vaccines for the pigs.

With the help of this loan she will be able to buy necessary inputs for agriculture. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. Her dream is to continue to get ahead, thanks to the loans that the cooperative provides to the farmers to further their progress. The challenge she faces is a lack of working capital. She spends her free time relaxing.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed and vaccines for pigs.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is a very selfless and humble woman. She has a retail shop that she set up together with her husband more than 10 years ago. Together with her husband, they are serving in the retail shop. She serves all the customers in her area, who prefer her business because of the humble and respectful service she offers them.

Louis requested this loan to buy food products, drinks, dairy products, vegetables, etc., so that she can further supply her store and keep it well stocked.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks, dairy products, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a single mother of four children. All the children currently go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a poultry farming business and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a Uganda shilling loan from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and vaccines. She generates additional income with rental rooms. She works from home and sells wholesale only, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, disease and transportation of poultry feed. She aspires to own 1500 chickens, to build more rental houses, and also to educate her children up to the university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of poultry feed and vaccines

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is 42 years old. She sells clothing, especially ladies' skirts. With the loan, she wants to buy more skirts and kids' clothing to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and kids' clothing to sell.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeleine is 27 years old. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for six months. She has requested this loan to buy more beers and sodas to upgrade her pub business. With the profits from the business, she will make more savings for a better future for her business.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is from Msambweni. She is 48 years old and is the companion of Benson. She works selling fruits and vegetables from a little shed in Msambweni. With sacrifice and dedication, she managed to get her three children ahead with the help of her husband. She is a very hardworking woman. She says she has always worked and she is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and to have a bigger shed to continue helping her family and her husband.

Ruth is coming to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply her business with top quality products to offer.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 28 years old. She is married with two children. She sells different merchandise in her store which she has been running for a long time. With this loan, she wants to buy more corn flour, rice and cooking oil to sell. With the profits from the business, she will make more savings. She has been very successful in all the cycles of loans she has obtained.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, has two children and lives in Msambweni. She works selling merchandise in her village. She buys and sells petrol. She sells in her neighborhood in the store. She comments that all the work she does is to be able to give her children the best, since she does not want them to go through the same deprivations she did.

Mariam is requesting this loan to buy petrol to stock up and be able to fulfill the requests of her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity she is getting.

loans.use: to buy petrol for resale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 33 years old. She is married with two children, and she works in a business with her husband. She sells different kinds of items in her business. With this new loan, she wants to add items such as corn flour, soap, rice, and sugar to her inventory to sell. She has already planned to use the profits from the business to grow her savings. Marie is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to upgrade her business and increase her volume of sales.

loans.use: To buy juice, lotion, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is the father of two children aged between five and eight, both of whom attend school. Emmanuel is 39 years old and married. He sells animals and with the loan, he wants to increase the volume of his sales by adding more rabbits, hens, roosters, and ducks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for his business' expansion in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits, roosters, ducks, and hens for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 57 years old. She sells “Bitenge” - ladies’ clothes. This is her other innovated business, which she thinks will be better than her previous business of animal sales. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Marie wants the loan to buy more "Bitenges" for sale. With the profits, she plans to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' clothing for selling

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Msambweni, where she has a small general store and sells used clothing. She tells us that thanks to the variety that she always sells, things are going well; she has developed a good customer base.

She is a hardworking woman; she sacrifices every day by struggling to get ahead so that she can have a better future. She has four children who are in primary school and high school. Mariam tells us that the reason she works tirelessly is for her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice, noodles, breads, beans, and more staples for her store. She is very appreciative for the help from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance for this growth opportunity for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, noodles, breads, beans, and more staples

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 38 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She wants the loan to add more items, such as soaps, salt, and rice for sale. She has been in the business for two years. The profits from the business will be used to expand her stock and provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more soaps, salt, and rice for selling

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 38 years old. She sells items in her boutique and has been in the business for two years. She wants the loan to add more stuff, such as cooking oil, lotions, and utensils for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, lotions, and utensils for selling

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 37 and married with 6 children between 2 months and 13 years old. Three of them are enrolled in school. With the loan, she wants to buy more potatoes to sell. She will use the profits for expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and has lived with her spouse for 15 years. She has 3 children, all of whom attend school.

Today, Rose has a lot of customers for whom she makes clothing. With the income she obtained, she was able to buy another sewing machine and cloth materials. With the loan she is asking for, she plans on financing herself a little better in her profession by buying more machines and getting raw materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and cloth materials

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 37 years old. She sells vegetables and fruits. She would like to get the loan to add more beans and different kinds of fruits for sale. She is planning to reinvest in the same business after obtaining the profits.

loans.use: to buy more beans and fruits for selling

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is an enterprising young client. She is 30 years old and has been married for years. She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school.

Saumu has owned her business for three years. She previously devoted herself as a full-time farmer while her husband was working, but she decided to open a food pantry to take advantage of the fact that there were no other places in her neighborhood to buy groceries or basic necessities. Saumu started out selling essential items and later increased her assortment of merchandise to include meats and beverages.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a variety of products, such as rice, meat, canned goods, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products, like rice, meat, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Mrichwa

texts.en:
Mrichwa is 63 years old. For more than 10 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables, which she buys at the market. At 7 am, she takes her children to the bus stop and then goes to sell her products in the businesses of her neighborhood.

She will use the loan to buy a larger amount of fruit and vegetables. She thanks Kiva lenders and Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a railing for the stairwell, cots, pillows and bedding for additional children, age-appropriate educational toys, tables and chairs for workstation areas and eating times, and to renovate the bathroom for children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for electricity changes, bathroom and fitting room renovations, flooring, paint and windows for her crafts and yarn store.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia El Futuro 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Yemeris is the coordinator of her group which is called Mujeres Hacia el Futuro 1, 2 & 3. She is a single mother with a child who lives with her in a simply structured home. This group is located in the rural village of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugarcane industry. The main economic activity here is the free-trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses.
