He is positive his business will succeed because he has been doing it for a long time, and from this activity the community will have a regular supply of wood at greatly reduced prices.

With the profit from the loan, he will educate his children and also take care of other necessities in the family. He says he prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates charged on the loans.

loans.use: To buy firewood and pay for splitting and transportation.

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa is married and has seven children and they live in a five-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam division of the northwest region of Cameroon.

She has faced many challenges in life including inadequate capital to start up and maintain a business, the temporary madness of her child due to a brain disorder, the death of some family members, and poverty in her family thus limiting her ability to better sponsor her children in school.

With the loan requested she will buy Irish potatoes, gari (a grain made from cassava), beans, corn and also do farming. She holds a strong positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and with her effort and hard work she is determine to succeed. She has regular customers who buy from her, and from this business, the community will have regular supply of food at all times.

With the profit from the loan, she will cater for her children's education, plough back profits for expansion and also diversify her business activity. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the gradual installment payment, encouragement to save and low interest rates on loans.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, gari, beans and corn.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 54-year-old married man with twelve children living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, he has been in the agriculture business and, with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and expand his farming activities. Unpredictable weather and price fluctuations pose challenges for his business, but he dreams of educating his children up to the University and venturing into mechanized agriculture. Julius intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.name: Muma

texts.en:
He is married with seven children and they live in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life among which are the death of both parents when he was still a kid, poverty in his family, inadequate finances to educate his children, and sickness that led to him being operated on.

With the new loan requested, he will buy rabbits, chicks and piglets to operate a poultry farm in his quarter. He is very positive this business will succeed because he has been assisting his brother in it for a long time and as such has the experience and techniques required to manage and maintain such a business. With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of pigs, rabbits and chicks at reduced prices and the droppings will also serve as manure to farmers around that locality.

With the profit from the loan, he will pay for his children's education and also provide them with other basic necessities. He says he prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, gradual installment payments and benefit of insurance enjoyed by members.

loans.use: To buy fowl, piglets and rabbits

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 38 years old. She is married with four children and they all go to school. Her husband works as a farmer. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, rice, and beans for sale. With the profits from the business she will renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is a young businesswoman. She is not married and lives with her father, mother and school-aged brother. She is psychologist. She was 18 years old and a student, when she launched her first business trading foodstuffs. But in 2009 she changed her business sphere and set up a beauty salon in Ijevan. Now Nelli is engaged in two different businesses: the hairdressing saloon and a butcher's shop which she organized with her Kiva second loan. 

With the second loan from Kiva, she bought a shop-window refrigerator for her newly-opened butcher shop. Nelli's parents help their daughter in her hard and different businesses. She also sells a lot of alcohol-free drinks and coffee. 

As her trading business is going well Nelli decided to add a variety of goods to resell but at the same time she doesn't want to close her beauty salon because a lot of customers like it. Thanks to Nelli's businesses her family's living conditions have improved. 

Nelli is seeking a loan amount of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a big quantity of meat for her butchery business and to add to the variety of the food she has to resell.

loans.use: To buy a big quantity of meat for her butcher business and to add to the variety of food she has to sell.

loans.name: Genita

texts.en: Genita lives at Alcala with her spouse and three children. Her house is located near a school, which is why she put up a stall to sell school supplies and grocery items to earn income. She had been in business for over ten years and usually earns about PHP 10,000 each month. She uses her income as revolving capital in the business and to pay the education expenses of her children. She is now applying a loan of PHP 30,000 to increase her merchandise, for better sales and profits. She will buy more school supplies (paper, pens, and notebooks), canned goods and soft drinks to sell. With good profits, she will be able to keep diversifying her offerings and make them more profitable, to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies (paper, pens, and notebooks), canned goods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en: Athanasie is 44 years old. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for 12 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en: Direct selling is the primary source income of Evangelista. She is 51 years old, and is married to Isabelo. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with four children. To generate income, Evangelista engages in the direct selling business. She has been in this business for more than four years. She usually receives a net income of PHP 2,500 a month for these activities. At this time, Evangelista is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 17,000 to buy lotion, deodorant and perfume to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy lotion, deodorant and perfume to sell

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 28 years old. She sells different items such as wheat flour, sugar and salt. She is requesting the loan to buy more items as mentioned above to increase the volume of her stock. The profits from the business will be used for building savings and paying the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a married woman and a mother of nine children from Bien Unido, Bohol in the Philippines.  She is engaged in a seaweed farming business together with her husband for more than 20 years now.

Bernadeth is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw and rope for seaweed farming. With this, she will be able to improve their seaweed farming thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to expand their business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw and rope for seaweed farming

loans.name: Twuungubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe  Twungubumwe et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 32 ans et  est mariée à Emmanuel, un commerçant de viande. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 1 à 12 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des produits vivriers (bananes, arachides, …) depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son  quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de produits vivriers (bananes, arachides, …),   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Avec les gains de son commerce, elle parvient à gagner sa vie en satisfaisant les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Jeanne, age 32, is a member of the group Twungubumwe and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a Emmanuel who has a meat shop. They have five children aged 1 to 12, three of whom go to school. 

Jeanne has been selling foodstuffs (bananas, groundnuts, etc.) for 20 years. This is her 15th loan cycle with Turame. She plans to use the credit to bolster her working capital and buy large quantities of foodstuffs (bananas, groundnuts, etc.) to sell and increase her profits.  

The earnings from her activity allow her to make a living and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock up on foodstuffs (bananas, groundnuts, etc.) for sale.

loans.name: Akwen Nkwenti

texts.en:
Akwen was born in 1956, and she is married and blessed with four children, all of whom are going to school. The fact that she was unable to acquire basic education because she did not go to school has made life very difficult for her, coupled with the fact that she was unable to cater for the family. The worst of it all was the fact that her children were unable to study freely because of fees, and they were also unable to have three square meals a day.  

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE in 2005 by her friends and relatives who are GHAPE members. Since then, she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans five times. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children's school fees and provide some basic needs like food for the family.

Given a loan, she plans to buy 3-week-old chicks, fowl feed and seedlings. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance management and how to choose a good business from GHAPE. She also says her community will obtain cheap table birds from her farm, and they will also have manure at a much cheaper cost.
 
She plans to use the profit from this loan to pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 3-weeks-old chicks, fowl feed and seedlings.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald es soltero y vive en casa de su madre en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja seis horas al día en un Café Internet atendiendo a los clientes.

Ronald necesita el crédito para pagar la inscripción y matrícula  poder entrar a la universidad ya que desea estudiar y su familia no puede con los gastos de educación.

El sueño de Ronald, es algún día, salir profesional y poder independizarse y, más adelante, ayudar a su familia para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ronald is single and lives in his mother's home in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. He works six hours a day in an Internet Cafe tending to customers.

Ronald needs this loan to pay enrollment and registration fees to enter university as he wants to study but his family cannot cover the costs of education. Ronald's dream is that one day he will become a professional and be able to become independent, and in the future help his family get ahead in life.

loans.use: to pay enrolment and registration fees to study at university.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en: Knarik is 64 years old. She lives in Ninotsminda district with her 68-year-old husband, two sons, retired mother in-law, daughter in-law and an infant grandchild. The family has two milk cows and a pig farm. Pigs are sold as meat. Knarik milks the cows to make dairy products, which she sells locally in the markets. In addition, Knarik’s older son is a seller in a cloth shop, and he receives a small monthly salary. Knarik has applied for a loan to buy food for her pigs. She will feed the pigs better, which will make them grow bigger. Bigger pigs will be sold for higher prices, and Knarik will make more profit. The increased income will help her big family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Yosia

texts.en: Yosia is a 50-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twenty-three years, he has been selling sodas, and the proceeds have made it possible for him to invest in a fish business. Good father that he is, he dreams of educating his children to attain degrees, as minimum qualifications, and of building a good residential house. Price fluctuations and inadequate food preservation equipment are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a depot. Yosia intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 31 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school. With the loan, she will buy bananas, potatoes, and cooking oil to sell. She will reinvest the profits in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, potatoes and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr: Paul est un jeune Camerounais de 36 ans. père de 03 enfants dont deux vont à l'école, Paul fait dans la vente de  boissons alcoolisées et hygiéniques. Ne disposant pas d'un stock assez consistant, Paul souhait avec l'argent du crédit acheter  des casiers de boissons. la plu value obtenu lui permettra de développer son activité, d'assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paul is a young Cameroonian of 36 years. He is a father of three children, of which two go to school.

Paul sells alcoholic and soft drinks. Paul would like a loan to buy some cases of drinks, because he often does not have enough stock.

Earnings received will allow him to develop his business and assure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in this business for over 6 years and earns 16,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 18,000PHP to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto is 30 years of age. He is from the village of Apanay, Alicia in the Philippines. He is married to Jovelyn. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with four children. To make a living, Alberto engages in buying and selling recycled materials in their village. He has been in this business for five years and earns about PHP 1,000 a week. He needs to have additional capital. In this regard, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy plastic, used cans, iron and metal to sell. He hopes to expand and grow his simple business.

loans.use: to buy plastic, used cans, iron and metal to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aminata est âgée de 52 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Pelengana Sud (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école pour se marier par la volonté parentale, elle débuta le petit commerce très tôt. Elle mène les activités d’achat vente de céréales depuis 17 ans  et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. 
Dans  le souci de renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 78 mois et bénéficia déjà de  3 prêts solidaires et 5 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 6ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 6 sacs de riz de 100 Kilos. Elle s’approvisionne  sur place. 
Madame  Aminata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à participer à des événements sociaux.
texts.en:
Madam Aminata is 52 years old, married and mother to 8 children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and her children in the Pelengana South neighborhood (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

Having left school to get married due to her parent's wishes, she started shop-keeping very early. She has been managing her businesses buying and selling cereals for 17 years and enjoys a great reputation and notoriety.

She is requesting this loan due to her concern to strengthen her business in order to meet her clientele's demands. She has been in a relationship with Soro Yiriwaso for 78 months and has already benefited from 3 group loans and 5 individual loans which were all well repaid. She is on her 6th individual loan which she plans to use to buy 6 bags of rice of 100 kg each. She gets her supplies locally.

Madam Aminata sells for cash and credit to a clientele consisting of men and women.

She plans to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will serve to reimburse her loan and to participate in social events.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo is a 34 year old fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than 6 years now. This is the main source of his income. Bernardo is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat. With this he will be able to improve his fishing business, thus increasing his income. In the future, Bernardo hopes to improve his business and livelihood more.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat

loans.name: Rhine Sheila

texts.en: Rhine Sheila is 24 years old, single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living by providing transportation services. She went into this line of work almost two years ago and now earns 10,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, Rhine Sheila is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy accessories and tires. She joined GDMPC last year and her hopes are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires for her transportation business.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is an Iraqi client who is 41 years old, married, and the father of four children. Nizar is the only provider in his family.

Nizar owns small restaurant and provides food services for his neighborhood.  He specializes in making fast food and shish kebabs. He has been in this field since 2003, and has gained good experience throughout his career.

Nizar is requesting a sum of $1,800 as a loan so that he may pay the annual rent of his restaurant. In the future, Nizar is aiming to renovate his restaurant, grow his business and increase his profits so he will provide his family better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his restaurant

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 21 years of age. He is from the village of Apanay, Alicia. He is married and blessed with one child.  To make a living, Allan is engaged in buying and selling recycled materials in their village. He has been in this business for three years and earns about PHP 1,000 a week. He needs to have additional capital. In this regard, he is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy plastic, used cans, iron and other metal to re-sell. He hopes to expand and grow his simple business.

loans.use: to buy plastic, used cans, iron and other metal to re-sell

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 44 years of age. She is a divorced woman and lives with her sons in Sabirabad. She has been dedicated for ten years to agriculture. Saida raises small animals. With the income that she receives from this activity she settles her personal expenses and helps her sons in the support of their families.

Saida desires to improve her business and to buy two more cows for her farm. Because of this she has requested a loan of 1500 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to help her achieve her objective. 

She is a responsible and honest woman. She has worked with our institution previously, showing exactness and responsibility in making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy two more cows for her farm

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 34 year old woman. She lives in Kartikami village, Akhalkalaki district with her husband, retired parents’ in-law and two children who are going to school. Her family owns an agricultural plot of land where they grow potatoes. They also have two milk cows. Marina milks the cows to make dairy products. She sells it with the harvested potatoes at markets. Marina is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds. She has an unused plot of land and wants to expand her agriculture and plant more potatoes to increase her profit. She will reinvest the profit in the same business which will bring her more income. With her increased income she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 52 years old. She sells different types of foodstuffs. She has been selling foodstuffs for one year. With this loan, she wants to buy more beans, potatoes, rice and bananas to sell. She wants to increase her savings with the profits.

loans.use: To buy more beans, potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a 48 year old married woman and mother of seven children. They all live in San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in the buying and selling of farm products like bananas, sweet potatoes and other root crops.
Bibiana is asking for a loan to buy more bananas and sweet potatoes. With this, she will be able to increase her stock, thus, allowing her to sell more at the market.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
Araz is 27 years old, married with two children. Araz is raising sheep in Imishli, because mutton is in good demand in this region. He has been in this business for seven years. 

Since high school, Araz chose not to study, but to continue the family tradition and to become a shepherd. This is a very profitable business and Araz is doing it together with his father.

Araz sells the mutton in the city market. He raises the sheep and brings them to the central bazaar. He has plans to expand this business, because mutton is in high demand in the market, due to its being used in the traditional meals of Azerbaijani people. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

Araz has already taken three loans from Aqroinvest and he has a good loan history. He is applying for a loan of 1500 AZN. Araz believes with this loan he can buy a dozen sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a dozen sheep and expand his business

loans.name: Jean Pacifique

texts.en: Jean Pacifique is 30 years old. He is married with two children, but only one attends school. His wife is still a student.  The loan that was requested will be used for buying scrap metal for resale. He expects to use the profits for building a house and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy more scrap for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 42 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an ice cream making business in the local community to earn a living. She has had business for over 6 years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make ice cream. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make ice cream.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a 53-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He has been in the farming business for more than 5 years now. He also makes kalamay. Kalamay is delicacy made of sticky rice, sugar, peanuts, and coconut milk mixed and cooked together.
Dionisio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and and additional ingredients to make kalamay like sticky rice, sugar, peanuts and coconut milk.
In the future, Dionisio hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and and additional ingredients to make kalamay like sticky rice, sugar, peanuts and coconut milk.

loans.name: Sharon's Group

texts.en:
Sharon's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Sharon  is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mbale  in the Mbale  region of Uganda. She is single  and has one child. For the past three years, Sharon  has been working hard to manage her small clothing store, which sells second-hand clothing. 

To help expand her business, Sharon  has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock and buy more different types of clothes, and will help Sharon  to generate greater profits and boost the business . Sharon  hopes that in the future she will be able to look after her family. 

Sharon  is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her stock and buy different types of clothes

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  Teddy lives in a rental house and her family has access to electricity and running water. For the past two years, Teddy has run a retail shop and she generates additional income teaching part-time at a nearby school. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. Teddy's monthly expenses include rent and school fees for her child. 

Teddy is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, small jerycans of cooking oil, and bags of bread. In the future, she aspires to become a wholesaler and also to save some money and buy a plot of land to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, small jerycans of cooking oil, and bread

loans.name: Garry

texts.en:
Garry is 36 years old and blessed with three children. He is a farmer and provides for his children through his farming business. Supporting his children through farming is really difficult for Garry. 

Garry is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide to improve his crop yield in the harvest season. He will use the profit from his loan to save for his children's schooling. Garry hopes that all of his children will finish their education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the motorcycle maintenance: change oil and buy gasoline and motor parts.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, in the Mbale  region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Fatina  has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells both ladies and men's clothing. 

Fatina is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase more clothing and help her to generate greater profits. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standard and increase her business profit. 

Fatina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Patricial

texts.en: Patricial lives in Sinkor, Montserrado County. She is 23 years old, single and has a child that is in school and lives at home with her. She stopped her education in the 9th grade, and from 2008 she has been selling rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, and others items in the market.  She needs more inventory to meet her customer’s needs.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita and others items to expand her business. She started this business with a little loan that she received from her sister and learned ways of selling from her friends. She enjoys the way her customers buy from her as well as having money in her home makes her proud. Her wish is to live a good life with her child.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita and others items to expand her business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela raises hogs. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Manuela has been engaged in hog raising for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.
Manuela is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising venture thus increasing her profit.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with three children who are all in school.
Peter is a farmer and has been for the past two years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more firewood to sell to his customers who are mostly the residents in Ndunyu Njeru.
He hopes to see his business expand in the near future and be the top farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married with one child and her child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of frying and selling Irish potatoes chips and has been in this business for 4 years. Besides selling chips she is primary school teacher. She works in a shop that she rents six days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation of bags of Irish potatoes to her home. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rental house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and paying for utilities.

loans.use: to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil to make chips.

loans.name: Wellington Oswaldo

texts.es:
WELLINGTON tiene 42 años de edad su estado civil es casado vive con la  esposa tiene 3 hijos vive en la ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

WELLINGTON se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, a demás se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida, ranger, vacunas para las gallinas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas. El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa.Su tiempo libre se dedica a leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Wellington is 42 years old. He's married, lives with his wife and 3 children in the city of Ventanas in the Province of Los Rios.

VRC Bendición de Dios can be found in the Recinto Rancho Grande of the Puerto Pechiche parish and they dedicate themselves to farming and raising cattle. 

Wellington is a farmer and sows maize and rice as well as raising animals such as chickens, ducks and pigs. He asks for this loan to buy urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, Ranger and vaccines for his chickens.

With the help of this loan, he'll be able to buy what he needs for his farming. The purchase will take place in Ventanas. His dream is to get ahead thanks to the loan granted by the cooperative. He spends his free time reading the Bible.

loans.use: buy urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, Ranger and vaccines for his chickens.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma earns a living through her 'sari-sari' or variety store business, selling various goods to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now.

Guillerma is asking for a loan to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, rice, shampoo and toiletries, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients, sodas and others. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. Guillerma is hopeful that one day she could experience fullness of life, together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, rice, shampoo and toiletries, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients, sodas and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snacks, beverages, and other goods

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is a 43-year-old farmer. He is married with four children: one daughter and three sons, two of whom help to run his business. Rustam's business provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family and he earns about 200 AZN selling his crops. He owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables and fruits but due to the poor quality of the soil and insect problems, Rustam is no longer able to satisfy market demand. He is very hardworking and determined.

Rustam is requesting a 600 AZN loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and tools. His loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home/

loans.name: Eduardo Alberto

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eduardo no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Ambiental, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco con Frejoles para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eduardo trabaja como operario avicultor en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eduardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de una habitación en casa de sus padres, ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada y desea hacerle el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso, de esta manera él y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Eduardo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 26 years old. He lives in the city of Chincha with his parents. He is a friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and out of a need to work since he was very young, Eduardo hasn't been able to study environmental engineering, but he would have really liked to. In his free time, he likes to listen to music and on occasion cook a delicious Seco con Frejoles to share with his family. 

On his own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Eduardo works as a laborer in poultry farming at a poultry farm in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he thinks it is going well for him because of his hard work and the friendly way he treats others.   

Eduardo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to do some improvements on a room in his parents' house. It is in bad repair and he wants to do some plastering, painting and put in a floor. This way, he and his family will be safer and better off. Eduardo will keep working and striving to achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to do home improvements

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a member of the Bidii Group in Kakamega South District. She is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and 2 men. Agnes is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Agnes joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Agnes joined the One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Agnes described her harvest as good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and send her children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Agnes’ group will receive 6 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Django

texts.es:
Django es dentista, vive en un pequeño departamento en la zona de Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja alrededor de diez horas al día en su consultorio ya que sus herramientas de trabajo necesitan renovación y mantenimiento.

Es por eso que solicita el crédito, para la compra de nuevos aparatos  y  mantenimiento de otras de sus herramientas.

El sueño de Django es mejorar su consultorio para poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Es la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Django is dentist, he lives in a small flat in the Pura Pura area of the city of La Paz. He works around ten hours a day in his dentist's office. 

As his work tools need to undergo repair and maintenance, he is seeking this loan to buy new equipment and to repair others.

Django's dream is to improve his dentist's office in order to give his customers a better service. This is the third time that he is seeking a loan via Kiva.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and repair other work tools.

loans.name: Onide Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 46 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con esposa  tiene 6 hijos vive en la ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Roberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, a demás se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos, pavo. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida, ranger.

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas. 

El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Los desafíos es no contar con un capital propio. Su tiempo libre se dedica hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Roberto is 46 years old and is in a common law marriage with his wife. They have 6 children and live in the city of Ventanas in the Province de los Ríos.

The Bendición de Dios communal bank is located in the community of Rancho Grande in the Puerto Pechiche parish. There people work in farming and raising livestock.

Roberto is a farmer and grows corn and rice. He also raises animals such as chickens, ducks, pigs and turkeys. He is asking for the loan to buy urea, liquid herbicide, and insecticide. 

With the help of the loan, he will buy what he needs to farm. He will make his purchases in Ventanas. 

His dream is to get ahead thanks to the loans that the cooperative gives. His challenge is not having his own capital. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid herbicide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old married man and the father of one child. For the past five years, he has been working in construction and he specializes in cement work. Ahmad is a hard worker. In the beginning, he had a few business problems because he didn't have a good number of customers, but he has gained the trust of almost all of his customers and they recommend him to others which is helpful to increase his business. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary iron pillars for his business. This is his fourth loan cycle and he is applying for a youth loan. His previous loans have helped him a lot. Ahmad hopes his loan will improve his business as well as his social and financial living. He hopes to expand and develop his work zone to provide his family with a good and healthy living.

loans.use: to buy iron pillars

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is married with five children and only three of her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister. Immaculate has a food stall where she sells eggplants, watermelon, pineapples, paw paws, and cabbages. She generates additional income selling sweets, cigarettes, and biscuits. She has operated her business for the past seven years, and works seven days a week. Immaculate's major business challenges include transportation, perishability, and seasonality. 

Immaculate is requesting a 600,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of watermelon, pineapples, eggplants, and cabbage. In the future, she hopes to grow some of her own vegetables and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, pineapples, eggplants, and cabbage

loans.name: Jose Clasio

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad su estado civil unión libre tiene tres hijos vive con el esposo y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

José se dedica a la venta de grano seco y a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de morocho, polvillo, vacunas para las gallinas.

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Su tiempo libre se dedica a leer.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and he is in a common law marriage. He has three children and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

The Bendición de Dios communal bank is located in the community of Rancho Grande in the Puerto Pechiche parish. People there work in farming and raising livestock. 

José sells dry grains and raises small animals such as chickens and pigs. He is asking for the loan to buy morocho, rice bran and vaccines for the chickens. 

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs to farm. He makes his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to get ahead with the loans from the cooperative. In his free time, he likes to read.

loans.use: to buy morocho (a grain), rice bran and vaccines for chickens.

loans.name: Imukusio Group

texts.en:
Imukusio is a group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District represented by John. The group has five women and six men. John is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. John joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. He joined One Acre Fund to grow enough food for the family and have increased profits to send his children to school.

John reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about eight bags of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan, during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 17 bags per acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, John’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 52 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She sells charcoal and different kinds of vegetables within her local community. Juliana used to sell house-to-house. She is thankful because, through her patience and hard work, she is able to get ahead in life. Juliana struggles to have enough capital for her business.

Juliana is requesting a  5,000 PHP loan to increase her stock of charcoal and vegetables. She believes that her business will continue to improve with continuous access to financial services and through adapting to new marketing strategies. Juliana hopes that her loan will help sustain her family, provide necessities, and allow her to save money to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children who attend school. For the past six years, she has operated a home-based grocery store where she sells the usual grocery items along with beverages. Sarah also has a pool table that generates extra income, especially on the weekends. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to pay school fees for one of her children. She will also buy rice, sugar, flour, and noodles at wholesale.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Angel Publio

texts.es:
Angel, de 43 años de edad, es originario de la comarca San Antonio, en las afueras de Estelí, casado tiene 5 hijos  con las siguientes edades 21,18, 17,16 y 11 años de los cuales tres están estudiando el resto le ayudan a trabajar en las labores agrícolas.  
Inicio sus labores como caficultor hace cinco años a la edad de 38 años cuando su padre le heredo  dos manzanas de tierra. La cual fue cultivada de café y al cabo de tres años ya estaba obteniendo su primera cosecha. Con las ganancias obtenidas compro  terreno el cual también cultivo con café hasta lograr la posesión de 4 manzanas de café que son con las que cuenta actualmente este ha sido su primer y único negocio. 
En esta actividad lo apoyan su familia. Su cosecha  lo comercializa a una exportadora de café. Su esposa como profesora en una escuela de la zona rural en la comarca San Antonio.

Le gustaría comercializar su producto a compradores directos sin intermediario para obtener mejores ingresos. Las expectativas que tiene de su negocio es ampliar el área cultivada, incrementar los rendimientos por unidad de área y vender a un mejor precio el producto. 
El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, plaguicida y mano de obra para darle mantenimiento a 4 manzanas de café. Sus planes futuros son mejorar su vivienda, compra de maquinaria y equipos para facilitar las labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Angel is 43 years old and from the district of San Antonio in the outskirts of Estelí. He is married and has five children of the ages of 21, 18, 17, 16 and 11. Three are in school and the rest help him with his agricultural duties. 

He began his work as a coffee grower five years ago when he was 38 years old and inherited about 3.5 acres of land from his father. He cultivated the land with coffee and at the end of three years he was receiving his first harvest. With the earnings received he bought land in which he also cultivated with coffee so that he now owns about 7 acres of coffee plants. This has been his first and only business. 

With this work his family supports him. He sells his harvest to a coffee exporter. His wife is a teacher in a rural school in the district of San Antonio.

He would like to selll his product to direct buyers without an intermediary to obtain greater earnings. His expectations for his business is to expand the cultivated area, increase yield per unit area and sell his product at a better price. 

The loan he requested is to buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor to do maintenance on his seven acres of coffee plants. His future plans are to improve his home and buy machinery and equipment to facilitate his agricultural duties.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide and labor.

loans.name: Jorge Roberto

texts.es:
JORGE tiene 26 años de edad su estado civil soltero vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

JORGE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,a demás se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, cerdos, polvillo y vacunas para los cerdos.

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Su tiempo libre se dedica hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jorge is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank Bendición de Dios (Blessing from God) is located in Rancho Grande in the parish of Puerto Pechiche and serves members working in agriculture and raising livestock.

Jorge works in agriculture growing corn and raising animals such as chickens and pigs. He is requesting a loan to buy chickens, pigs, animal feed and vaccines for the pigs. With the help of this loan he will be able to buy the supplies he needs for farming. He will purchase these items in Ventanas.

Jorge's dream is to get ahead with the help of this loan from the co-op.  In his free time, Jorge enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, animal feed and vaccines for the pigs.

loans.name: Elsi Antonia

texts.es:
Elsi, le surge la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de venta de pupusas. Esto le ayudara para comprar maíz, arroz, frijoles, quesillo, gas, chicharrones y así poder ir incrementando sus ganancias.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar su clientela. Actualmente la Elsi presenta un problema de salud porque fue operada de la matriz, gracias a los ingresos de su negocio ha salido adelante.
texts.en:
Elsi needs to invest more in her pupusa selling business. This will help her buy corn, rice, fresh cheese, cooking gas and chicharrones and increase her earnings.

The previous loan helped her improve her income and grow her clientele. Right now, Elsi has health problem because she had uterine surgery. Thanks to her business income, she has gotten ahead.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, fresh cheese, cooking gas and pork cracklings.

loans.name: Mirian Jahaira

texts.es:
Marián tiene 20 años de edad su estado civil soltera vive con sus padres vive en la ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Marián se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, a demás se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida, ranger, morocho.

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas. El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Su tiempo libre se dedica a los estudios.
texts.en:
Marián, 20, is single and lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas in the Province of los Ríos. VRC Bendición de Dios is located in the Recinto Rancho Grande in Puerto Pechiche parish; they work in farming and raising cattle. Marián works in farming, growing corn and rice in addition to raising animals such as chickens and pigs. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, Ranger (brand of herbicide) and morocho (dry cracked corn used in beverages and food). The loan will help her to buy what she needs for farming. The purchases are made in Ventanas. 

Her dream is to get ahead thanks to the loan granted by the cooperatives. Her free time is dedicated to her studies.

loans.use: to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, Ranger (brand of herbicide) and morocho (dry cracked corn used in beverages and food).

loans.name: Ana Yamile

texts.es:
“Los sueños son el motor de la existencia” Con esta frase, Ana Yamile de 33 años de edad, narra su historia y como ha llegado crear su restaurante. Cuenta que para salir adelante le ha tocado afrontar muchas dificultades debido a que sufrió el abandono de su cónyuge y debió hacerse responsable de los gastos en su hogar, velando por la educación de sus dos hijos menores de edad. 
Debido a su necesidad económica, Ana comenzó laborando como operaria, con la idea de ahorrar y montar en un futuro su propio negocio, situación que le permitiría dedicarles más tiempo a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y a un  programa realizado en la ciudad de Medellín para apoyar a mujeres cabeza de familia con ideas de negocio. Ana resultó beneficiada y desde hace un año tiene negocio propio, dedicado a la elaboración y comercialización de alimentos.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el objeto ampliar su portafolio de productos y ofrecer una mejor calidad en el servicio.
Su mayor deseo es poder garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y asegurarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
"Dreams are the engine of existence." With this phrase, Ana Yamile, 33-years-old, tells the story of how she came to open her restaurant. She relates that she has faced many obstacles while trying to move forward. Her husband abandoned her and she was left with all the household expenses as she tried to pay for her young children's education. 

Because of her financial situation, Ana began working as an operator with the idea of saving enough money to open her own business that would allow her to spend more time with her children. Thanks to her hard work and a program in Medellín that supports single mothers in business ventures, Ana was able to open her small restaurant a year ago. 

Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy staple ingredients so that she can expand her menu and provide better service to her customers. Her greatest dream is to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life and ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy staple ingredients.

loans.name: Elsa Maruja

texts.es:
Elsa tiene30 años de edad su estado civil es casada vive con esposo tiene 4 hijos vive en la ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, a demás se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida, ranger, vacunas para las gallinas.

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas. El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Su tiempo libre se dedica a descansar
texts.en:
Elsa, 30, is married and lives with her husband and 4 children in city of Ventanas in the Province of los Ríos. VRC Bendición de Dios is located in the Recinto Rancho Grande in Puerto Pechiche parish; they work in farming and raising cattle. Elsa works in farming, growing corn and rice in addition to raising animals such as chickens, ducks and pigs. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, Ranger (brand of herbicide) and vaccine for the chickens. The loan will help her to buy what she needs for farming. The purchase is made in Ventanas. 

Her dream is to get ahead thanks to the loan that granted by the cooperatives. Her free time is dedicated to relaxing.

loans.use: to purchase urea, liquid pesticide, insecticide, Ranger (brand of herbicide) and vaccine for the chickens.

loans.name: Sandro Ernesto

texts.es:
Sandro, posee un taller de enderezado y pintura. El vive en casa de su abuela con su esposa y su hija de 2 años de edad, Su mama está en Estados Unidos y le ayuda aunque no continuamente. 
El inicio su negocio desde hace 5 años, eventualmente le ayudan otros mecánicos cuando es necesario y les paga por obra, la ventaja que tiene es que es muy conocido y por ello tiene clientela; no paga local porque trabaja en la casa y este oficio la aprendió desde que estaba en bachillerato. El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de pintura thiner, macilla, base y otros materiales para pintar un sedán. 
La inversión que requiere será de mucha importancia porque el vehículo que desea pintar lo pondrá a la venta y tendrá una buena ganancia, lo único que tendrá que esperar para ver sus utilidades.
Se encuentra muy contento porque lo obtendrá rápido dicho préstamo además piensa en hacer más grande su negocio en un futuro con mejores herramientas de trabajo. Lo cual necesitara más préstamos para poder realizar su plan.
texts.en:
Sandro owns a bodywork and paint shop. He lives in his grandmother's house with his wife and 2-year-old daughter. Sandro's mother lives in the United States and helps him, but not consistently. 

Sandro opened his business five years ago. He learned this trade in high school. Now, he is very well-known and has a good customer base. Occasionally he helps other mechanics, when necessary, paying them for their work. Sandro does not have to pay rent for his business because he works out of his home. 

He is requesting this loan in order to buy paint thinner, putty, paint and other materials to paint a sedan. This is an important investment for Sandro because he will be able to sell the car he paints for a good price.

Sandro is very happy to receive this loan so soon and he plans to expand his business in the future, buying better tools to work with. For this he will need additional loans in order to carry out his plan.

loans.use: to buy paint, paint thinner, putty, and other materials to paint a sedan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his equipment and purchase supplies.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que PADECOMSM le brinda. Con ello poder comprar variedad de ropa para luego venderla, esta actividad siempre la realiza al igual que la venta de plasticos.
Con el crédito anterior ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado brindarle ayuda a su familia. Les ha sido de mucha utilidad porque ha crecido el negocio y en su casa con los gastos económicos.
texts.en: Rodolfo is asking for a loan because he needs more working capital and the good attention paid to him by PADECOMSM. With the loan he will be able to purchase a variety of clothing and then resell it. This is just one of his enterprises, he also sells plastic goods. With his previous loan he was able to strengthen his business and with the earnings he made he was able to help his family. It was very useful to them because Rodolfo was able to grow his business and take care of household expenses.

loans.use: purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, de 56 años de edad, padre de tres hijos los cuales están estudiando en la universidad. El habita en la ciudad de León, estudio la carrera de Química anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa de productos químicas él era responsable de laboratorio, pero la empresa cerro y con la liquidación empezó su negocio de ventas de productos de limpieza que el mismo labora utilizando envases de gaseosas desechables. Lleva 5 años con este negocio con el cual ayuda a sus hijos para que estudien. Sale a vender sus productos de limpieza para el hogar  a pulperías, casas y empresas. 
Él está requiriendo el crédito para comprar ácido sulfúrico, aceites esenciales, aceite de pino y soda, envases plásticos. Todos estos materiales forman parte de la materia prima con la que trabaja diario. En sus planes futuros desea agregar la venta de nuevos productos tales como jabones de uso corporal, jabones para reducir grasa y lograr tener una mejor presentación en sus productos, logrando establecer una empresa de productos de limpieza junto con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 56, is the father of three children who are studying in university. He lives in the city of Leon. He majored in chemistry and used to work for a chemical products business. He was responsible for the laboratory, but the business closed and with the liquidation, he started his business selling cleaning products that he makes using disposable gasoline containers. He has done this business for 5 years, and he uses it to help his children go to school. He goes out to sell his home cleaning products to grocery stores, homes, and businesses. 

He needs the loan to purchase sulfuric acid, essential oils, pine oil, soda, and plastic containers. All of these materials are part of the raw materials that he works with daily. In the future, he plans to include new products such as body soaps, soaps for reducing oil, and improve the presentation of his products. The goal is to establish a business selling home cleaning products together with his kids.

loans.use: purchase sulfuric acid, essential oils, pine oil, soda, and plastic containers.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is a 56-year-old man, married with four children. He breeds cattle and sells the meat to local butchers. Vidadi has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle.

Vidadi usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. In addition, meat selling brings in 400 AZN income per month for Vidadi. His brother helps him to graze cattle and look after them. People use beef in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce.

There is only one income in his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Vidadi applied for 1000 AZN to purchase three baby calves. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of his income.
Michael is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for use on his farm. In the future, Michael hopes to make his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for use on his farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old from Nyandarua South, and is married with two children who are in school.
Elizabeth has a retail shop that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy eggs, cooking fat, soft drinks, etc. to add to her store stock.
She hopes to see her business enlarged in the near future and open up a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cooking fat, soft drinks, etc. for her shop.
